This trip included just my husband and I for a small mid week getaway. Our flight had us in early at 9am, the hotel was more than happy to hold bags until our room was available which allowed us to get right to hitting the streets for the day!

 We were given the option to upgrade our room for an additional cost, the additional cost included a Central Park view, and let me tell you what. It was worth every penny. I honestly did not want to leave this room. The window seat was the best! The amount of thought that went into each detail of this property and room is more than I ever expected. The décor, the staff, the view, the location. It was beyond perfection. One evening it started to sprinkle, we were out and about but decided to swing back to the hotel to see if they had an umbrella we could borrow, and sure enough as we walked in, they were placing a bucket of umbrellas for us to head back out with! 

I normally hate leaving day when I've been in the city, but this time, I really didn't want to leave. If you are thinking about staying here, do yourself a favor and stay! Upgrade your room, get a view! You will be happy you did!

I usually stay at different hotels when I come to the city, but next time I'm coming right back here!

Thank you to the wonderful staff for a perfect stay!

title: Great location, great atmosphere
text:
We had a weekend getaway to NYC planned after a long time at home with the kiddos. We wanted to be close to Central Park and this was the perfect spot. It was one block from CP. The hotel was hipster and organic. Nature first.
We stayed in the room with a queen bed. This room does not have a view. The room was very open. (The bathroom had a wall of glass, but it did have a curtain.) The timer in the bathroom shower is something we may start implementing with the teenagers at home! I liked how the room had a yoga mat. Inspired me to continue my yoga practice each morning. Bar downstairs was neat. We got drinks there both nights and tea and coffee in the morning.  Our room for two nights was a little over $1,000. Parking not available, but there was a lot right next door. Staff was very pleasant.

title: Cool concept, glad I did it once
text: Hotel is one block off Central Park. Views are limited. Hotel has a great lobby it’s small but the smell and feeling is great. Booking 3rd party will leave you at a disadvantage. I was going to book directly through the hotel site on my way to the hotel in the cab a park view king room. However, third party was able to give me a better rate i just booked it and thought i could upgrade at the hotel. Upon check in i was told the only room available was a king that faced the back of the hotel. After getting into our very cool but VERY small $350 a night room without room service for the stay. I checked again online and the other rooms were available. I would have been happy to pay the difference I’m disappointed the front desk was not honest. Both nights of our stay the people next to us and above us were basically in our room, we could hear them talking and walking around. The bed was comfortable, the water pressure was great, the decor is cool. The vibe is overall really great. I wish they would have been straight up with me. The fruit and yogurt parfait is amazing. The staff overall was friendly. For the price in NYC i expected a bit more and probably won’t stay here again. However, if eco friendly, smaller rooms with queen size beds, cardboard straws and reclaimed things are your wheelhouse you will LOVE this place.

title: HOME AWAY FORM HOME
text:
My stay was, to say the least, EXCELLENT. I discovered this hotel during COVID in 2020 and I will continue to visit NYC staying here. This is my home away from home. 
From the greeting upon arrival, to the reception staff, to the security team, to the team keeping my room clean and sanitized, to the staff at JAM... EVERYTHING IS PERFECT! 
My last visit in March and April 2021 was long and I had the opportunity to know seveal staff members personally and ... THEY ARE ALL WONDERFUL! 
They made me feel at home and taken care of. THANK YOU! 
A special thank you goes to the door staff (morning and evening) : Shane, Luis and Andrew. Always smiling, polite, respectful, ready to assits and professional. 
You make this hotel a special place. 
I have recommended this hotel to several friends (all completely satisfied) and I will continue to do so! 
If you are looking for a great place to stay that combines perfect location,  perfect service and perfect ambiance for both work or leisure visits to the City  ... this is it!!!

title: An oasis in NYC
text: The 1 Hotel Central Park was fantastic.  The eco-friendly decor was beautiful and very soothing.  The rooms were very clean, comfortable and had plants to add to the atmosphere.   The bath products were awesome - I even bought them to take home.  The staff was excellent and went above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied.   We were traveling with our small diabetic dog and the staff made sure that the refrigerator for his insulin was setup in our room before we even got there and that we didn’t need to use the minibar for storage.  The location cannot be beat - one block to Central Park and one block to Fifth Avenue for shopping.   We are already planning  our next stay.  Highly recommend.

title: 1 Hotel Central Park
text: This place was amazing! I’m glad I booked my stay here. The location is amazing. Walking distance to Nobu, fashion district, and Central Park. The staff makes you feel like your at home. I got to be the first to experience the house car, which was Audi Etron Suv. They give you two hours free to take the car for the hotel guest. I usually stay at four seasons resorts but i will definitely come back here!!

title: Nothing short of Remarkable
text: 1 Hotel Central Park is beyond what we expected. From the moment we walked in we were greeted with impeccable customer service and it smelled REALLY good. The room was clean, comfortable, and the hotel is located in a wonderful part of the city. Close to shopping, restaurants, coffee shops and did I mention SO close to Central Park? We walked there every day during our 5-day stay. The hotel even has its own cafe! I started each morning with freshly squeezed juice and my husband recommends the flat white coffee. The hotel itself is unique, down-to-earth, very nice and they go above and beyond for the environment which was a fun unexpected bonus. Not to mention the staff is genuinely helpful, kind, and resourceful. To sum it up---we loved the place and cannot wait to come back!

title: Beautiful room with a natural and sustainable feel and mission
text: We stayed for 2 nights and had a fantastic experience! The rooms were very modern and fresh looking with a very cool concept. The hotel is very focused on a natural feel and sustainability and you could definitely tell that from the furniture to the eco-friendly accents. The bed was very comfortable, the window seat was a delight (my girlfriend spent a lot of time sitting there just looking out on the edge of the Park) and the different lighting controls were fun. The only knock I could think would be that the hallways actually reverberate sound pretty easily, so it's not difficult to hear people outside on your floor, but that didn't really bother us. I would highly recommend anyone to stay there!

title: Night in the City
text: The service at this hotel from end to end is superb. From the moment I found 1 Hotel Central Park I was impressed. Before booking I had some questions after viewing their website, and I received helpful and informative information from the guest service staff when I contacted them over the phone. Not only did they answer all of questions, but they also shared fun background information about the hotel, as well as their willingness to try to accommodate early check in whenever possible. After my call did not result in a booking, as I was going to book online on my own after deciding between a few other hotels in the Central Park area, the staff kindly continued our wonderful conversation and ended with a pleasant we hope to see you this weekend. Booking online directly through the hotel was so easy, the hotel offered a deal with a great rate, complimentary late 1 PM checkout, as well as a $25 credit to the wonderful restaurant Jam's at the hotel! On our way into the hotel in the morning from out of town, we called (after 10 AM as suggested by the staff), and requested early check in and the staff happily noted my accommodation request. We were able to get early check in at 2:00PM, 2 hours before their regular reservation start, and after a very long night of work (after 6:00AM), even were accommodating with a 1:30PM check out. The service did not even end as we checked out, as they offered to check our bags for the day as we were not leaving the city just yet! We are so pleased with our lovely stay here at 1 Hotel Central Park, and cannot wait until we come back!

title: Ms.
text:
From the moment we entered the lobby, the guest services agents were so welcoming and helpful.  Joshua at the front desk made sure our room was ready, while Lorenzo the concierge set us up with three great dinner reservations.

The room size and storage is on the bigger side for a new Central Park hotel, very comfortable.  Our King bed was sumptuous while the quality and selection of towels was excellent.

The location is superb, and while the restaurant Jams is still gearing up to back to full service, we enjoyed excellent juices, smoothies, cookies, soup and coffees in their very comfortable space.

We recommend highly!

title: quiet, nice service, welcoming
text: The view was amazing and the decor was refreshing, eclectic, yet comfortable.  The service was wonderful and welcoming.  It felt like a true escape even though we were in the heart of New York City. It was welcome relief from recent months, to say the least.  (Bonus: there was a lovely scent in the common areas)

title: LOVE this eco friendly hotel
text: staff is top notch - from valet pull up to when we left, totally accommodating (forgot toothbrush, ear plugs, etc. no problem they helped me). Rooms are beautiful and all eco friendly which is amazing. Gym has pelotons and woodways - very high end. Great location, easy to get anywhere especially park. Stayed for business this month and last and was very pleased, this is my go to hotel in NYC now.

title: Just average
text: I cant speak too much to the hotel because we ended up leaving after a few hours. Luke warm shower (at best), first time at a 1Hotel and while I told them that at check in, it didn't result in any explanation of the hotel and what amenities were open or closed... cant speak to room service or if food was available (I wasn't told)... reservation was for a friend to spend the night rather than on my cramped couch, but hot water had him opting for my couch. Maybe we just had bad luck.

title: "Cozy and Inviting" ...
text: Very pleased with this hotel ! I have stayed at NYC's finest hotels and enjoyed this hotel as much or more. Great location, one block from Central Park & exclusive shopping. There is a great deli/grocery store and a Starbucks across the street which was ideal as so many restaurants are closed right now. The main hotel restaurant was closed because of Covid 19 but there was a great cafe and bar in lobby that was open with expresso, bakery items and sandwiches that were homemade and delicious.  I was concerned about staying at a hotel during the pandemic but felt very safe and comfortable at 1 Hotel as it was very clean and the staff was attentive and professional. Check in and out was a breeze. The room was small but it was perfect with a boutiquey casual vibe and an awesome city view!

title: 1 hotel
text: Went here for a one night getaway with a friend. Through discussion via email with the hotel, I mentioned how we were nurses getting away for the night. The staff were so generous and accommodating. We had a really beautiful room with a view of Central Park. The staff left a note in the room thanking us for serving the frontlines during this pandemic. They really went above and beyond for us, which we were very grateful for. Great experience, I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Peaceful and Relaxing
text: My boyfriend and I always enjoy visiting NYC and this hotel is right in the middle of all the best must view sites. The room was perfect! They provide you with a little gift bag of face masks&sanitizer. The room was relaxing and had a touch of earthy feel. They even had refillable bottle waters in the mini fridge all around the hotel. One of the best hotels in NYC. We’ll definitely come back here again! Thanks to Josue and Michael for making our hotel stay great. They even let us leave our luggage for storage after checkout, so we could continue exploring the city. The room had soft bathrobes, slippers, and you can adjust the lights in various ways too!

title: A very nice, eco-friendly boutique gem in South Central Park area
text: It is a lovely hotel inside out. Very impressed with cleanliness, covid safety, room design, thoughtful amenities. Love the outstanding communication via text and hotel app chat. Hotel own-branded shampoo, conditioner and lotion are amazing. Exceptional customer services from doorman, concierge desk and reception. The location is super convenient. Center of everything! 1 block to CENTRAL PARK. 1 block to the famous Fifth Ave. Close to MOMA museum. Walking distance to Times Square and Rockefeller Center. Definitely will stay here again for next trip!

title: 1 Hotel Central Park NY
text: Excellent service from the doorman Andrew front desk Joshue,Tracy and Michael. The room was so clean and spacious. Love the wood designs. Step away from the park I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Best  Location and beautiful hotel!
text: I booked this place to celebrate my friends birthday. Overall the hotel is gorgeous, we booked a room overlooking the Central Park which gave us an awesome view of the park. The front office manager Michael is doing a great job managing the place, it reflects to the front desk cheerful staff which is  Tracy and Joshue,  Andrew the bellman is making sure he assist with your needs. I called the housekeeping for some extra towels and Grace is very friendly to assist us.  We will come back again it's a good experienced and we feel safe, the place is well sanitized.  ( I fear you covid!)

title: Great Place and Outstanding guest service
text: Every aspect of our stay exceeded our expectations. Great Staff, very friendly and  attentive. Housekeeping is just a phone call away and they attend to our needs as soon as possible. Rooms are very clean and I  feel safe as everything is well sanitized ( Covid is not a joke!). I would like to acknowledge  Michael the Office Manager for doing a good job  managing the place,  Tracy and Joshue at the front desk are very helpful and nice. Andrew the bellman is a happy person and also Grace from housekeeping is answering all our question with social distancing, over all the ambiance is great.  We booked last Dec 2020 and stayed for 2 days.

title: Mixed Feelings... hope to be back to get the real experience next time!
text:
Having lived in the city for years, my husband and I usually do our EOY wind down upstates or somewhere far far far from the crowd. This year, we no longer live in the city, so thought it'd be nice to take a visit to the city on the new year's day and do the things we used to do like jogging in Central Park, shopping at Columbus Circle, or simply people watch on the street. 

I chose 1 Hotel Central Park mainly for its cozy interior and the location. Upon arriving at the hotel, I immediately fell in love with the interior. It was exactly what I thought the hotel would be... the smell, the light, and the warmth! Everything was perfect until the morning... as I woke up to get ready for my jog in the Central Park, I came to realize there was no running water on the premises. 

After getting in touch with the front desk receptionists, I learned that there was some work being done in the city and unfortunately went wrong, so we wouldn't get water until further notice. Shocking and annoyed, I know it wasn't the staff's fault, so all I asked was to keep us informed and let us know if there's any alternative solutions found. As the last receptionist I spoke to promised to keep me posted, I sat and waited next to the hotel telephone but the phone never rang. Our morning schedule was ruined... no jogging, no showering, and worst of all... no water to even flush the toilet. 

As it got close to our checkout time, I was packed and ready to leave the hotel. I decided to give the front desk one last call because I couldn't believe there was still no update after close to 4 hours since my initial call. I made the call and soon learned that the hotel staff was instructed to give guests water bottles since the city was still trying to figure out where the pipe issue was. I was furious because we were never told from the previous staff we spoke to ... nor did we receive any voluntary updates until this last call was made. If you're still reading this review, maybe you think I'm an annoying guest. But let me be clear ... I made no complaints to any hotel staff since the morning because I know it wasn't the staff's fault that there was no running water. My simple ask was "let me know when the water will be back. Thanks". The staff in the hotel, they were simply the messengers which means they failed at doing their job at this point. 

Frustrated and disappointed, I expressed my anger to Chris, the hotel staff I spoke to last. He apologized for his colleagues and immediately sent water bottles to our room. He later promised to take care of the hotel charges & fees for us. If it wasn't for Chris, I think this review would have been 1 star. In fact, after Chris took care of us, it made us want to give 1 Hotel Central Park another shot. 

After we checked out from the hotel, ironically, I saw two text messages from the hotel automated system. One says we're free to use the water bottles provided in the mini bar at 8:47am. The other one says the water is back on at. 11:18am (like literally after we checked out). The problem then became apparent to me. The hotel used "technology" for its communication but it didn't work in time. No staff told me to watch out for text messages and all my focus was waiting for the hotel phone to ring since that last the means of my communication with the staff throughout this time.

Having stayed at many different hotels in the world. I truly had the fixed feelings about this experience. The hotel was lovely and the staff was helpful on individual basis but the dots were not connected across the system; hence, the overall experience was poor. Very poor indeed. 

I'm writing this review in the hope that the hotel management team would acknowledge outstanding customer service from Chris but also want to point out what's broken in the system so that it can be fixed for future reference because I truly hope to experience 1 Hotel Central Park the way it's been designed to experience! Good luck.

title: Beautiful and sustainable hotel next to Central Park
text: I took my family to this hotel for a staycation in NY.  It is right next to Central Park and conveniently located to major attractions like MOMA and Rockefeller Center. I upgraded to a room with the a beautiful view of Central Park.  The beds are comfortable and the service is first-class.  I would stay at this hotel again.

title: Pandemic Wedding Oasis
text:
As you can imagine, being a bride during 2020 has been the opposite of an enjoyable experience. 10 days before our wedding day, our original hotel chose to close down due to COVID. I was looking for a unique, kitschy, boutique experience and was I ever surprised by what I found in 1 Hotel Central Park. The website doesn't give too much away about their appearance and I won't ruin the surprise but it is WILDLY gorgeous, smells heavenly, and is so safe and clean. Walking into the lobby you feel like you're taking a timeout; a really high class, relaxing timeout. Not to mention their staff is incomparable in kindness, helpfulness, and generosity of spirit. We dealt closely with their manager Miriam, desk clerk, Josue, & doormen Andrew and Shane. These people were professional while still being personal. As it was our wedding, they went beyond all expectations I had to make it a special weekend for us. When we left they felt like family, if for no other reason than I will remember them as such a crucial part in pulling off my wedding day.

I'd also like to add: their COVID protocols were clear and concise without tainting the experience. It's hard to do anything right now without COVID being all up in your face, no pun intended. At 1 Hotel Central Park, everything is SO CLEAN in general but the social distancing measures they've taken are obvious but tasteful.

title: Great location - stunning hotel
text: Stayed in a King Park View room which was lovely, I especially liked the window seat looking out over the park. Their covid measures made me feel very comfortable and safe. The park is a very short walk as is Carnegie Hall and the lovely Brooklyn Diner which is unfortunately closed due to indoor dining restrictions currently.

title: Great staycation
text:
I chose to stay at 1Hotel Central Park for my 25th birthday. The location was perfect; it’s near Central Park and several steakhouses. I arrived with my mom to the hotel around 11am to drop off our bags before heading to the Met. The lobby is gorgeous and smells amazing. The manager was very friendly. He gave us a complimentary upgrade and said our room was already ready if we wanted to head up. I was impressed. The hallways of this hotel are beautiful and quiet. 

Once inside our room we realized it had a great view of Central Park. Plus we were put on one of the highest floors, 14th out of 18 I believe, so that was even better. The bed was extremely soft, plenty of towels, and the shower was to die for. I like how they have a Bluetooth speaker to play music as well. Oh also plenty of full length mirrors to check yourself out before heading out. 

All in all there are so many great things about this hotel. I just named a few. It’s definitely worth the price tag. Luxurious in a modern and sustainable way.

title: Amazing Customer Service
text: 1Hotel has proven to be a professional establishment where customer service/satisfaction is a priority of theirs. Thank you for stepping and providing your assistance. You now have a customer for life!

title: Lovely hotel in a great location. Highly recommend.
text:
We stayed here for 6 nights in October while my husband was recovering from surgery.

I thought the hotel was lovely and perfect for our needs. The location is great - we had a glimpse of Central Park from our room. 

The rooms are a decent size for NYC. We had a 2 bed room and the beds were very comfortable. I loved the mix of natural wood and fibers with the modern touches (room lighting, television and an app to contact the hotel staff if you’d rather not call.) 

I thought the glass partition looking into the bathrooms would be strange, but it wasn’t. There is a curtain and a door to the bathroom for privacy. The two shower heads in the shower were a nice touch too.  

The staff were all very friendly. They seemed to take Covid quite seriously as well. There were ample hand-sanitizing stations and a covid amenities kit with masks wipes and sanitizer. 

I had a number of special requests for my husband because he had just gotten out of the hospital from heart surgery and the hotel accommodated all of them.

The only downsides were that we stayed during Covid, so the hotel restaurant was essentially closed (there was some take-away service.) And the weather was miserable during our stay. But neither of those were within the hotel’s control.

I would highly recommend 1 Hotel Central Park and would definitely stay there again.

title: Amazing weekend stay. Will definitely be back!
text: Spent our wedding night at 1hotel, couldn’t have picked a better place to stay. Thank you Lorenzo for helping set up the rose petals and champagne prior to arrival. Loved feeling special during our visit here. Will be back!

title: 1 hotel Central Park
text: I had a really nice stay, eco friendly hotel with wonderful staff. The front office director l,Maryam, was very helpful with me. I find I had a really nice stay, eco friendly hotel with wonderful staff. The front office director , Maryam, was very helpful with me. I find the idea of the business cards to plant very innovative! Sharing is caring the idea of the business cards to plant very innovative! Sharing is caring

title: Great choice!!!!
text:
I live in NYC, but we had to leave our apartment for a week while there were fixing a problem in our newly renovated apartment. 
We decided to stay at 1 Hotel Central Park because of the convenient location walking distance from home. 
I could not have been more satisfied with our stay. The room was spacious with plenty of storage and sitting area. Bathroom was very comfortable, good shower!!! Despite the Covid situation the room had a very useful Nespresso machine and a well stocked minibar. 
People at the  reception, concierge, and members of the staff were extremely nice and helpful. Michael was so sweet always asking about the status of our apartment!!!
I will definitely suggest the hotel to friends visiting NY!!!!

title: Exceeded expectations
text: Friendly and attentive staff. Went above and beyond to make me feel comfortable during our stay. Would definitely recommend to others. Clean and worth every penny. Will continue to stay with One Hotel in the future.

title: Vacation
text: This place is immaculate. Very atuned to maintaining covid standards. The staff are very friendly, helpful and efficient. Rooms have beautiful views of central park which one block from the hotel. My new favourite hotel to stay at in this city. I highly recommend my friends, family and anyone else to stay here.

title: Amazing service, design and education
text: First things first, this hotel is an amazing oasis in the middle of a midtown. From the moment you walk into the building the organic design and warm service feels like you are transported to a nature preserve, not the island of Manhattan, while at the same time distinctively incorporating the best parts of the city into the overall design - it will wow you.  This hotel takes sustainability to another level., The design incorporates live plants, warm reclaimed woods contrasted with stunning brick work and living walls. I would be remiss if I did not call out Nicholas the General Manager, what a gentleman and Lauren who provided me a property tour and challenged me to rethink my concept of luxury.

title: The most underrated hotel in New York
text: Very good experience. It’s my first time staying at1 Hotel Central Park. We were stunned by all the plants and trees there as we arrived. The front desk was very nice and friendly. The room was not a luxury type, but it is very clean and tidy. The location is also very convenient. Good value for money

title: Unforgettable Stay
text:
During the time of the Coronavirus and my wife surgery. We could have not chose a better hotel in NYC to stay during this time. We stayed for nearly 2 weeks and the staff was great, the service was awesome and the hotel was always so clean!!
We will return when we can spend a less stressful time frame, but the 1 Hotel staff made the time of stress so much less..
And special thanks to Chris at the front desk that made our experience from the start a great choice!!!
All the best
G & K

title: Love this place
text: Another wonderful stay at 1 Hotel Central Park. The warm welcome back greeting and constant looking after from the wonderful Josue at the front desk made this another stay to remember. I’ll be back soon!

title: One of the best places to stay NYC
text: I hesitate to write this review because I selfishly don’t want 1 hotel Central Park to get too popular so that there’s always a room for me when I visit NYC. I used to live in NYC and travel internationally a lot for work and therefore have high expectations for 4- and 5-star hotels. After checking 1 Hotel out online - I was unsure whether the experience would live up to the reviews and images. It sure did. From start to finish, the staff was professional, friendly, and very accommodating. The rooms were true to the pictures. I upgraded to the Park view King and definitely worth it. Beautiful corner room with a view of the park. The rooms were very quiet and comfortable and a welcome aesthetic and aromatic departure from the historic moldy hotels that don quilted headboards and old carpet. On the contrary 1Hotel’s modern decor and sparse aesthetic lets the beauty on NYC captured through the guest room picture windows shine through.  I’m planning to make this my go-to hotel to stay during the annual spring art gallery shows. Did I mention that it is also dog-friendly? Thanks 1 Hotel Central Park!

title: On The Macy's Parade Route
text: We booked this hotel, in a comparatively expensive room type on Thanksgiving, and specifically so that we'd have a view of the Macy's Parade. The lovely lady named Ansagona who checked us in went to so much trouble to re-arrange things for us so that we had a perfect room on the third floor with a perfect view of the parade. The whole experience at 1Hotel while we were there was just amazing, and I couldn't recommend them too highly. Thank you so much again to Ansagona, you should know that your care and efforts were what made this trip perfect for us.

title: Зеленый оазис среди каменных джунглей
text:
Трудно представить, но в самом оживленном городе мире возможно найти   спокойствия и уединения. 
Этот отель сочетает самые современные тенденции эко-дизайна и комфорт в классическом понимание.  На наш взгляд - прекрасный выбор для молодой динамичной публики.
Номера декорированы старым деревом и фактурным камнем,  оснащены по последнему слову техники самыми современными системами управления. Один вид на Центральный парк чего стоит, не говоря уже о прекрасной мягкой кровати, и тихой уютной обстановке во всем отеле. Изюминка отеля - "зеленая" внешняя стена нижних этажей здания.  
Ресторан отеля предлагает исключительно здоровую пищу, приготовленную из свежих сезонных продуктов, выращенных в фермерских хозяйствах. Предусмотрено и множество приятных мелочей: корзинки для пикников в Центральном парке, карта звездного неба и бинокль для романтических вечеров в парке.
Несколько автомобилей Tesla в распоряжении гостей отеля для путешествий по городу

title: Great employee
text: After having numerous problems checking in along with many other guests, Christopher E at the 1 Hotel Central Park, saved the trip and our decision to stay at the hotel.  He was simply fantastic.  1 Hotel, you should be proud to have Christopher E working for you.

title: amazing modern hotel with exceptional customer service
text: let's start with the location. it's one block from central park south (.5 mile from tavern on the green within central park) which makes getting to the most iconic place in NYC easy. subway from JFK airport was simple (especially with logistical help from the 1 Hotel staff).The hotel smells of zen (think sandlewood, mint and plain yummy goodness) which immediately relaxes all. the whole hotel was a superb combination of craftsmanship/design/architectural detail and greenery infused at every turn. the detail in the room included blackout drapes/all glass shower (that you could shade it desired) in room robes and slippers and a cozy, pillowed nook to take in the sights. special shout out to the manager Nicholas who made every piece of the stay easy, organized and offered to help repeatedly and shout out to the bartender zane (a fun conversationalist) who helped up decide on the best craft cocktails and delish eats @jams restaurant on the property (highly recommend the kale salad). this is my third 1 Hotel stay (1 Hotel Miami and 1 Hotel Brooklyn Bridge before this 1 Hotel Central Park jaunt) and the the customer service at all locations was superb, the differentiator at this location is the personalities of the staff. they seemed genuinely excited to engage with the staff and always remembered us when we came back. if you are looking for a place to stay that makes you not want to go home, 1 Hotel Central Park is the gorgeous spot. cannot wait to go back :)

title: Found out new place in NYC
text: Excellent room, well furnished, and eco-conscious. Staff are absolutely superb. Location can’t be beat, with easy access (walking) to Upper East Side shopping, and a short cab ride to the Upper West Side (Hello, Lincoln Center). The Park is literally a moment away, and subway stations are as close as a minute’s walk. Did I mention the staff? 😃 some of the friendliest and most helpful of the many hotels we’ve stayed in here. The “Hotel Car” for trips of 15 blocks or less is a gorgeous white Tesla. Lastly, the affiliated restaurant is Jams - good food, nice focused wine list, and (again!) very nice people. If you want to feel at home on your next trip to NYC, you cannot beat 1Hotel, Central Park.

title: Tenía altas expectativas.
text: Me encantó el balcón que tiene la habitación con sus cojines. No me gustó que el baño  es todo con vidrios, falta de intimidad. Los armarios son pequeños y sólo tiene un sólo cajón. La comida del restaurante se me hizo excesivamente cara y mala. Por otro lado, tiene una excelente ubicación. El personal es muy amable y atento.

title: Neat place
text:
First One Hotel stay and was quite nice. Super eco conscious.  Rooms small c/w NYC --"alcove queen" but very neat, clean, tidy.  Super nice bathroom.

Bar area with great cocktails but small as well. Overall great experience different from the typical "old school hotel."  One min walk from Central Park.

title: Best Hotel Stay
text:
From start to finish, the experience of staying at 1 Hotel Central Park was outstanding. I downloaded the app prior to arriving and sent a message to the staff asking for down-free bedding. A staff member replied very quickly and told me that it wasn’t a problem at all. The app was super helpful throughout our stay whenever we had a question or wanted room service. 
The hotel itself celebrates nature and the environment. Beautiful plants can be found throughout the lobby, hallways and in the rooms. The rooms are absolutely stunning   and had everything we needed for a fantastic getaway. 
We appreciated the free fruit cart in the lobby and the Nespresso machine in the room. 
We had dinner and breakfast at the hotel restaurant, Jams. The service was spectacular and the food was wonderful. 

We cannot wait to go back for another stay. Everything was perfect!

title: Perfect!
text: We enjoyed our stay so much we can't wait to book our next visit! We originally booked a queen size suite and were upgraded to a king with a view of Central Park on the 10th floor.  An unprompted complimentary upgrade!

title: Loved this green hotel!
text: The staff was friendly and great, the feeling of the hotel is wonderful and how green they are is very special! What we loved most of all was the window seat.  Where I would take breaks and read or share a glass of wine before going out! The location to the subway is also perfect!

title: Two weeks in a cool update trendy hotel with partner & teenagers. Perfect locale.
text: A small hotel with no interference and instead remedying of any issues raised.  The staff are unpretentious. It's a warm place. Brilliant recycled timber cool. Get a room with a window to lie in and ponder the view. Expensive in Australian $ but worth it. Teenage kids loved it. Perfect NY location metres from subway. Get your breakfast included. Hey Chester B big friendly guy on nightshift, nice chatting.

title: Another awesome stay at 1 Hotel Central Park
text: My wife and I have stayed here 4 times, sometimes up to a week and we love it. The environment is awesome, with so many details taken care of. The team always remember us and are delightful. The room service is speedy. Gym awesome. The bar and the excellent food attract a terrific crowd. We hardly ever leave the hotel, it's too comfy! Highly recommend 1 Hotel NYC!!!

title: Outstanding
text: I have absolutely all good comments about this hotel, the design is amazing and carefully selected to be eco-conscious. It has a very cool and laidback chic vibe. Staff was really helpful and welcoming. The app of the hotel is the best for time saving and comes in very handy when selecting room service or exploring the hotel activities. Definitely recommend to stay here. My absolute best.

title: A peaceful sanctuary
text: I love my stay there, the decoration of the room based on wood and natural material is warm and cozy. I loved the spirit of the place, all the notes around the room about sustainability and being more conscious for the planet. The location is perfect!

title: In love with this hotel!
text: Perfect location, close to everything! The hotel is absolutely beautiful, small and cozy. And the staff is fantastic, they make the hotel and stay unforgettable. Michael B. at the front desk is a gem, terrific service and personality, went above and beyond to make sure we had a great time, he definitely elevated our experience at the 1 Hotel. Thank you so much for such amazing time!

title: Beautiful Trendy Hotel
text: I stayed here for one night when on business in the Junior Suite. The room had a sitting area with a couch and then a separate bedroom with lots of beautiful recycled wood and super comfy bed. When I arrived they were doing free cocktails with whiskey and charcuterie- which was delightful. They also have a workout facility and free fruit down in the lobby. I love their views on recycling and sustainability- There are recycling bins in the room, a timer in the shower to minimize extra long showers, a pitcher and glasses, and notes to encourage reuse of towels. I highly recommend this hotel!

title: 超出預算較多
text: 酒店位置很好在第五大道購物方便，去中央公園和洛克菲勒都在10分鐘內，時代廣場大概15分鐘。早餐有中式套餐60$，價格在紐約算高的但味道還不錯。訂的時候含早但每人有限額，超過後另外收費的。餐飲客房服務人員都有華人，服務還是蠻好的，住了4天沒看到有華人入住都是老外而且年紀大的居多，問了友人在當地算檔次蠻高的酒店。老大樓設施和香港上海的半島不能比，每天還加收45$的稅。如果考慮性價比的不建議訂，會超出預算較多

title: Just a few niggles.....
text: This is a great hotel, modern, friendly and very professional staff and you do feel that sigh as relief as soon as you walk through the door. The room was of a really good standard, comfortable bed, great shower and air conditioning that did the job. Wardrobe could have been bigger, would have struggled with two people, but that's really being picky. Annoying that was not told the restaurant was closed until I arrived a check in and the experience of trying to collect my suite case on the day I left was just really poor, although recovered after a 10 minute wait.

title: Best in New York
text:
I am a big fan of the hotel because it is absolutely cozy and very central. Also the staff were all extremely friendly and courteous with no exception. I was travelling alone and visited New York for five days.  I felt so comfortable and safe and just in good hands.

The atmosphere, the ambience of the lobby, my room, the Jam Restaurant just inviting and very cozy, with pleasant music, nice light and a nice fragrance concept.

My room was on the 14th floor and because it was so comfortably furnished it didn't bother me at all that it had view to the courtyard.

The eco concept appeals to me particularly, the coffee, the teas and everything else from the minibar is organic, you can even drink the tap water (it‘s filtered). It was great to simply order a soy cappuccino to my room with the app. I got an answer that it could take up to 30 minutes but after 10 minutes it was already delivered and this service is available 24 hours a day. I also loved the hoodie bathrobe in jogging suit fabric.

The food in JAMS is super delicious and again everything is organic - perfect for me, because I enjoy the same quality on vacation as at home.

One evening JAMS was closed due to an event, but for hotel guests there was a delicious buffet and drinks in the lobby, a very nice idea!

The apple bar every morning in the lobby with regional organic fruit was great.

I have rarely been to a hotel with organic amenity products that smell so good as shampoo, conditioner, body lotion did.  I have long hair, so it was especially nice for me to see that the hotel also put a hair tie in the shower.  Someone was just thinking!

On my check-out day the street was closed because ice sheets came down. A staff member was escorting me and my luggage to the the Plaza Hotel where my driver was waiting.  That's what I call excellent service.

In conclusion, I have never been in a hotel where the overall package was so close to perfection. See you next year, same time, same place :-)

title: Year after year - we love our home away from home
text:
Shout out to the concierge Richard and Lorenzo , also Michael at the front desk, these guys are pro’s. I have already positively reviewed this hotel and will renew my appreciation once again. We love feeling like regulars here and truly feel at home when we stay . Thanks 1 Hotel , your dedication to the environment while creating a top notch experience is much appreciated- we CAN have it both ways. 
See you next year!

Best,

Sibhan

title: Expensive but worth it
text: We visited NY just before Thanksgiving for 4 nights. The hotel was excellent in every way. Staff are attentive but not too in your face, ambiance is intimate but not small, decor is contemporary without being too try hard. Rooms are small by European standards, but really well specced and comfortable.

title: Great hotel
text:
I had a fantastic stay here.  The location is wonderful (right by the park), the staff is so kind and helpful and welcoming and the food in the restaurant is very good.
The ambience is warm and inviting and unique and the bed and room were very comfortable.

title: Dissapointed on 2nd stay.
text:
I was returning to stay in this Hotel after a good satisfaction experience from my last stay  in an accessible King Room 3 months ago.

This time, I stay in a Double Bed non accessible room, and I just realize that this Hotel is not suitable for family.  The bathroom, which surrounded by 2 glass wall, doesn’t have any privacy at all. The privacy curtain only covers the sight from the bedroom area and It still can be seen from the entrance door.

I will not recommend for the guest travelling with family staying in this Hotel, unless they can get an accessible room which has a solid wall bathroom.

title: Perfect!
text: Excellent service from all - especially Chris and Chris!  Lovely place to stay in NYC.  Clean, modern, quiet and very comfortable.  The lobby area is fun and energetic.  Great location for all city activities.

title: So glad we found this hotel
text: Will definitely stay here again next time in the city. Hotel seems to be all new. Great restaurant on first floor. Rooms are large, considering we are in NYC. Staff was amazingly friendly. Price was right. Love!!!!!

title: Location and service!
text:
1Hotel is located incredibly conveniently for a fun visit to NYC.  One block from Central Park, a Subway station a few yards away and an easy stroll down 6th Ave to theatre, restaurants and more.
The staff is very friendly and helpful.  Want a recommendation?  They're on it.   The in house restaurant (James) is also very good.
As a little lagniappe, the hotel's complimentary "shuttle" is a Tesla Model X.

title: Multiple stays, all fantastic
text: We love this hotel and stay every time we're in NYC. It's a block to Central Park, a few blocks to 5th Ave and surrounded by restaurants. The hotel is charming with a chic nature/forest vibe, lots of wood and ferns and a signature scent. Richard and Stephanie at the concierge desk were extremely helpful, Richard remembered us after our very first stay and went out of his way to make our visit special.  Don't hesitate, if you're wanting a fun boutique hotel in the middle of NYC you found it.  Book now.

title: Cozy & Rustic in NYC
text:
Had a wonderful week long stay a couple weeks before Christmas. This hotel has a very warm, lodgy feel to it. Very cozy lobby with spaces for sitting & decorated beautifully for the holidays. If you’d have blindfolded me I would’ve thought I was in a rustic Vermont B & B. Excellent location walkable to gorgeous Central Park, lots of great restaurants & the madness of Fifth Avenue, Rockefeller Ctr & Times Square if that’s your jam. Our room had a super cool window nook for reading & a peek of the park. Love the rustic feel of the rooms.
Only complaint-
Wide open windows to the bathroom so even with the curtains pulled there’s not a lot of privacy.
I’ll definitely return!

title: Holiday weekend
text:
Great location 1 block from South Central Park.

Not a large hotel if that is your preference but great service, great food, great rooms and amenities. We also had a sense of safety. 

We would not hesitate returning for another stay.

title: Chateau by the Park
text: My wife and I have lodged at One Hotel about 8 times, and, in every case, the ambiance, service, and room cleanliness and amenities have been outstanding.  Of particular note, is the friendliness of the staff and feeling that you have found a relaxing oasis in the heart of Midtown.  The adjacent restaurant, Jams, adds an extra touch of excellence.  Patrons of One Hotel are of all ages and seem to share a happy attitude which is unusual in a big and busy city.  One Hotel Central Park is also conveniently located for easy access to all Midtown attractions and Central Park.

title: Beautiful Hotel Undermined by Poor Staff Communication
text: The hotel appearance is worthy of a high level boutique. The hotel location a block from Central Park and walking distance of Columbus Circle and Rockefeller Center is great. There are many other pluses but my stay was severely undermined by unfulfilled promises due to poor communication between staff, managers who were not readily accommodating, and poor follow through when errors were noted and later compounded. For a pricey hotel their apology was stingy.. upon reservation I had been promised a $100 food voucher. Problems: the room was not ready at 6 pm at night. The only apology was the offer of a bottle of water. They had no record of the voucher and expected me to show them the paperwork. They eventually found the paperwork but when we check out they double billed us rather than crediting us. Prior arrangements were made because of dietary restrictions. On two occasions these had not been passed on to the kitchen and at dinner on Thanksgiving it took 40 minutes just to get a roll. But that is only the beginning of the problem. The dinner ended up being free, which was warranted and I am grateful. That is how the hotel should have handled other issues. In the end of our stay, I experienced at least 4 major incidents and the overcharge for the room. I didn't receive a written apology or a deduction of the cost of my room. Clearly, the different departments need to coordinate better and the managers need to be better trained on communication and in apologies for errors that are of their own making. For these reasons, I give the hotel a poor overall rating. Which is too bad because the hotel has many positives.

title: Nature plus luxury
text:
Worth the splurge. Love this hotel! Cool, modern, different. Everything is sleek, luxurious and inviting, yet environmental consciousness reigns supreme. Service is personal, quick and easy.  Rooms have window seat alcoves for a great city view. The theme here is nature. The only decorations are living plants. 
     Downside: almost no place in room to unpack: 2 tiny drawers, tiny closet. Be ready to go with the flow. 
      Upside: apple cart in lobby for healthy snacking. Comfy room with natural decor. Great food at restaurant Jams morning till night. Good communication via app. Nespresso and clothing steamer in room. Location! Special thanks to front desk, Christopher E. always ready to help with a smile. Personal service. A-plus hotel!

title: room for improvement
text:
For a 5-star hotel for which I paid $900 a night, I expected a lot more. The best aspect of this hotel is its location, right near Central Park, luxury shopping at Bergdorf's, the new Nordstrom Flagship, etc., short walk to MoMA, Rockefeller Center, Columbus Circle, etc. I will also preface this review by saying everyone who works at the hotel is courteous, hard-working, and doing their best in a tough physical space. What do I mean? Well, first of all, the lobby area is tiny, crowded, and cramped. You have people trying to check-in and check-out; basically what amounts to a little larger than a podium stand as the concierge desk, and three small seating areas to "relax"--all within a very tiny footprint. I arrived on a Friday evening--well past the official check-in time of 3pm--and was told my room wasn't ready yet and was being "inspected." The front desk gentleman offered to comp me a drink in the lobby while I waited. I was tired from a long flight and just wanted to get into my room. There was literally no place for me to sit, even if I did want a drink. I also find it unacceptable to not have the room ready. Management should operate the hotel with the assumption that every single guest is checking-in at 3:01pm. Again, at almost $1,000 per night, I was pretty floored.

There were also some usability issues and details with the room that made my stay less than enjoyable. For example, the bathroom had almost zero counter space. And my in-room Nespresso machine was broken (I even watched a YouTube video to make sure I was pushing the right buttons). The hotel is not soundproof enough. One morning around 8am I heard the couple next door having sex loudly (he was a screamer). And later on, a baby was wailing for an hour. Meanwhile, the three elevators are quiet but excruciatingly slow and small. 

Since the hotel is eco-friendly, they encourage you to download their mobile app as the main way to order food, learn about hotel amenities, etc. So I downloaded it and ordered room service for dinner one evening. When I was finished, I went on the app to request tray pickup. I received confirmation that my request was received. Well, the next morning, my tray was still outside my door and never picked up. I also ordered coffee one morning as part of room service breakfast (my Nespresso machine was broken, remember). It was the most tasteless, weak coffee I've ever tasted. I resorted to walking across the street to Starbucks every morning.

title: Sensational Eco Hotel Experience!
text: This is now my third stay at 1 Hotel Central Park and every time I find more to appreciate in the healthy and lux environment. The care that is taken in providing sustainable, yet comfortable surroundings is second to none. From all of the little touches like triple-filtered water, mini blackboard tablet & chalk (saves on paper!) and the live wood desk. It truly makes you feel that you are taking care of the body, the mind and the planet. Finally, the food is organic, creative and outstanding! We had snacks, dinner and breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed every bite! This has now become my go-to hotel when in NYC.

title: My new favorite Hotel in Manhattan
text:
Amazing hotel near Central Park in Manhattan

Summary
I almost hate to reveal how great this hotel is for fear it will be booked up next time I go!!  I stay here quiet regularly now and it is my first choice when going to NYC.

Rooms
Nicest rooms I have stayed in for a long time.  Cozy with warm wood furniture and accents.  Bathroom was very cool and well designed.  Organic cotton, supportive but comfortable mattress, great bath amenities.  Room are perfectly clean and maintained.

Food
Excellent food choices in the hotel with Jams and room service.  

Staff
The staff is very friendly and willing to help in any way with a smile.  Hard to say much other than "excellent"

title: Absolutely Amazing Experience
text:
I have been very blessed and fortunate to have witnessed the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade in person with my family every year since 1986.

For all of those years, what also became a great tradition for my family and me was to come into New York City early on the Wednesday before Thanksgiving, and then spend the entire day enjoying many of the wonders that the great City has to offer. We would then sleep over at a hotel at or near the Parade route, and get up early on Thanksgiving morning to see the Macy's Parade (and even occasionally enjoy a room with a Parade view). 

Over the years, as the Parade route would occasionally change, my family and I stayed at the Dream Hotel on Broadway, the Manhattan at Times Square Hotel on Seventh Avenue, the JW Marriott Essex Hotel on Central Park South, and the Park Lane Hotel, also located on Central Park South. And as wonderful as our stays were over the years at those hotels, none of them compared to our recent Thanksgiving stay at the 1 Hotel Central Park Hotel.

Everything is just perfect about this hotel, from its location (just steps away from Central Park South and Central Park itself), the eclectic yet beautifully adorned rooms (which are kept absolutely spotless), and most importantly the entire staff, who always went the extra mile to accommodate all of our needs, and did so with a smile and a lot of holiday spirit. They were all just SO great.

The experience was just phenomenal, and we definitely plan on staying with them again next Thanksgiving, and at any other time we decide to come into New York City.

title: Amazing experience from start to finish
text:
The hotel and staff were first class. Hotel lived up to its images online and surpassed expectations for service - reception, concierge, door staff - would definitely recommend to anyone. 
Car service taking guests 15 block radius was a super bonus. 
The eco concept of the hotel is perfect and  the smallest of details reflect that. 
Quality products in the rooms. 
Jams restaurant great vibe and yummy food. 
Perfect location for top half of manhattan to midtown.

title: Love this forward thinking hotel!
text:
Maybe there is a reason this property is near Central Park as it feels as if you are staying in a treehouse with all of the amenities and services of a fine hotel.  And that it is.
The smell, as you walk in, is woodsy.
The restaurant and public areas are warm and inviting.  And the staff...so friendly, welcoming and accommodating.  Spencer (concierge) recommended the best restaurants and was extremely helpful in every way. 
This forward thinking hotel is focused on the environment and being GREEN...and the set up of the beautiful and well-appointed rooms makes it all so easy.  There are the most cozy window seats in the rooms...perfect for lounging and reading. The bath amenities are to die for...so wonderful, I had to purchase them. 
The location is great....close to the new Nordstrom, Central Park and center of midtown. 
We can’t wait to return!

title: Green and Calm
text:
Had a wonderful visit in this calm oasis just steps from everything. A highlight was the window seat with great views of the city, sheltered by curtains. Appreciate the attention to sustainability and the quality of everything from sheets to hand lotion.

We went down to the restaurant to borrow utensils for the eats we'd purchased on the streets, saw what they were serving and promptly asked to be seated for dinner! It looked that good, and it was.

title: Raggiro eco trendy
text: Ottima presentazione esterna, reception minimalista e con tante piante sparse ma molto buia e di dimensioni ridotte e in massima parte condivise con il bar ristorante annesso. Personale alla reception distaccato e molto poco accogliente, concierge poco concierge. Stanza a dir poco piccola "alcove room" di nome e di fatto, condizionamento di aria rumorosissimo, materassi "depressi" come anche la visuale dalla finestra (cortile interno!). Su cinque notti per ben due giorni e in tardo pomeriggio si è dovuto chiedere di riordinare la camera. Pertanto, il famoso rapporto costi (500 - 600 $ al giorno)/qualità non regge.

title: My recent one hotel Central Park stay - fabulous as always!
text: I returned to nyc for business and had another great stay at the One Hotel.  I love this hotel- the staff is amazing, the rooms is luxurious and comfortable.  And opportunity to stay at the one, we do. We can’t wait to return next week for thanksgiving .

title: SIMPLY AMAZING!
text: From the booking to the arrival it was simply an amazing experience... All services requested made me feel the staff were always ready to go above and beyond. A huge THANKS to Spencer and the concierge crew for making my trip very close to perfection... Definitely my place to stay in NYC forever...

title: Chic Hotel. Wonderful staff
text: Very cool vibe but backed up by excellent service. Leena was charming at check in but became an angel when I realised I had lost my iPhone. She was so helpful and resourceful. Can’t thank her enough. Service from everyone was exceptional

title: My second stay at 1 Hotel Central Park
text:
I first visited in the year the hotel opened. I was so impressed with the service, location, bay window seat that I vowed to return. Pity it took 5 years until my next visit to NYC. 
The hotel has not lost its shine. Clean rooms, useful amenities and perfect location for my conference two blocks away. I’m not a fan of staying at conference hotels. 
There is also a hotel car that I hope to use tomorrow.

title: We will be back!
text:
A friend recommended we try this place out. Great advice! Had a wonderful time. The rooms were great and had many amenities. Perfect location and fairly easy walk to most places. Away from the craziness of the theater district but easy walk. The staff was exceptional. Friendly and helpful. The restaurant/bar Jams had a great breakfast and was perfect for pre-dinner drinks. Though we didn't try it (next trip) the steak house Quality Meats is right across the street as well. 
All around a great experience. Definitely plan to be back.

title: Superb stay!
text: We reently checked into 1 Hotel and wish we didn't have to check out!  Michael B. and the front operations team was beyond excellent!  Courteous, professional service-they even remembered our names throughout the stay.  The room was something special - a true respite in the city.  We had dinner and drinks in Jams and it was delicious.  The only down side was some drunk patrons who were out of control and should have been asked to leave.  The location was perfect for everything we wanted to do.  I had stayed at 1 Hotel South Beach and was looking forward to this property.  It didn't disappoint.  Michael B. was top notch!

title: Hotel senza pretese
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel il 15/11
Ben pubblicizzato sul sito , una vera e propria delusione dal vivo 
Non vale più di un tre stelle 
Camere piccolissime , fredde , senza anima .
Dovevo rimanere 5 notti , ma al secondo giorno sono fuggito
Troppi rumori 
Aria condizionata fastidiosissima e rumorosa 
Ho cambiato hotel 
Mai più - lo sconsiglio vivamente

title: Great Stay at 1 Hotel Central Park
text: I had a great stay at 1 Hotel Central Park. Very cool hotel. The room, service and hotel were excellent! Very Eco Friendly and will definitely stay at another one of their properties. The one in NYC has a great location and can’t wait to stay there again.

title: Unique & Refreshing Hotel
text: From the moment you see the 1, you know you’re in for a special stay. Live plants, reclaimed wood and special details abound. We particularly loved the window seat overlooking Central Park. Would definitely recommend!

title: Outstanding Hotel.
text:
Great location just outside Central park and a few blocks from Time Square.
We had a corner room with a view of Central Park. Room was very clean, spacious and well appointed.
The staff was pleasant and greeted us with a smile all day long. The lounge was lively and the bar staff poured a great drink. Breakfast at JAMS was excellent.

title: Great, Green, Gracious
text: 1 Hotel was recommended by our interior designer daughter who knows great hotels. From the outset, the staff was gracious and welcoming. The location next to Central Park is major plus especially if you're a walking/running enthusiast. The interior environment gave a woodsy vibe with appealing scents in the big city. The rooms were very cool and comfortable with a spacious shower and scented soaps. The bar and dining area was hopping and the food/drinks were very tasty. This hotel is awesome!

title: 1 Hotel!!
text: Awesome location and such an attentive staff.  A bit of a tricky booking...Chris and Michael B checked us in and out with ease. The restaurant was cozy and offered a great selection of starters and entrees.  The rooms were so clean and comfortable.  Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely go back.

title: New Favorite Hotel
text: Very cool hotel with an organic feel. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Rooms were super clean and comfortable. Great location next to Central Park, Roc Center, and the Theater District. Will stay here again!

title: Perfect. Did not want to leave.
text: The hotel's exterior, lobby and rooms are an eco-aesthetic triumph. The service was exemplary. Every staff member I came in contact with was welcoming, friendly, helpful. Every detail was considered, from choice of fair-trade artisan chocolates available in-room to the infinitely-adjustable accent lighting in the suites, I did not want to leave.

title: 1 Hotel
text: Great location, modern and eco with great staff.  Rooms are on the smaller side but staff was super responsive.  Food is excellent.  Eco friendly look and feel inside.  Bar is active and restaurant is always packed.  Gym was a surprise - had real equipment and weights.

title: Top Flight Service & Superior Accommodations
text: Quite an extraordinary hotel and oasis of refined hospitality in the midst of NYC chaos. Staff were polite, professional and always quick to make my stay stress-free and enjoyable. Decor is sustainable chic, which isn't a bad thing. To the contrary, it helps to reinforce the holistic approach this hotel employs in creating a wonderful guest experience. Strongly recommend this brand.

title: Perfect Location
text: We stayed 4 nights in the alcove suite. The hotel is in a great location a few minutes walk away from central park and the subway.  The staff were very attentive always ready to help.  I love the whole green sustainability focus of the hotel and the attention to detail is amazing.  I would recommend the experience to everyone

title: Beautiful property, wonderful staff
text: We came in to run the marathon and had a great stay.  We enjoyed being able to run in Central Park, the room service was quick and easy, all requests on the app were answered swiftly.  The window nook in our 12th floor corner room was lovely and had beautiful views.  We slept well, everything was quiet...when we saw the cleaning ladies in the hallway they were quick and eager to give us any extra coffee/towels/etc.  Overall it was a really enjoyable stay.

title: A great experience!
text: This is an excellent hotel. Very well positioned. You feel welcomed at arrival and supported during stay. All people are truly customer oriented. The rooms are excellent and the location is perfect. The Green focus of the hotel is clear and every little detail is focusing on sustainability. Experience to be repeated!

title: Perfect location
text: We enjoyed our 4 nights stay at 1 Hotel Central Park. The hotel is well situated near Central Park and very close to the subway. The staff was friendly and the room was well laid out. I would highly recommend this hotel for its uniqueness and commitment to the environment.

title: Block of Rooms - Large Party at JAMS
text: For the NYC Marathon, we had a block of 6 rooms and had two reservations at JAMS for diner with a party of 12 and 18, respectively.  The Hotel staff was very accommodating throughout the process and at several points throughout the weekend addressed our needs directly.  Not only does the hotel have a great vibe, but the staff embrace the attitude and positive energy that goes along with it.  Great location also.  I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a high class trendy hotel.

title: Loved the concept, well executed.
text: The room is good in size, and really well appointed. The sustainability theme is remarkable, and the small details like no paper in the room, or the sand clock to time water consumption while taking a shower are making a difference. Great location, one block to Central Park. Breakfast a la carte, efficient service and good quality of food.

title: 위치적으로 아주 만족!
text: 센트럴 파크와 아주 가깝게 있어가지고 아주 만족스러웠습니다. 센트럴 파크에 자주 산책을 나갈수 있어서 좋았고 산책하면서도 숙소가 보여서 더욱 만족스러웠습니다. 위치만 보고 숙소를 정했는데 위치뿐 만 아니라 룸컨디션이 매우 좋았고 청소 상태도 매우 괜찮았습니다. 또한 직원분들이 매우 친절하셨기 때문에 다음에도 이곳에 머물고 싶습니다.

title: Geweldig hotel!
text: Wij verbleven 5 dagen met ons gezin (4 pers) in dit geweldige hotel. We hadden een connecting queen & king room en dat was een top keuze! Geweldige kamers, mooi ecologisch ingericht en doorgevoerd in details. Ontbijt was ook heerlijk! De locatie is perfect. Op loopafstand van vele bezienswaardigheden en metrostation om de hoek. Wij gaan zeer zeker terug! Enorm genoten.

title: Me decepcionó
text: Ya me había quedado otras veces y bien. Pero esta última que regresé, todo mal... el restaurante pésimo y los meseros de muy mal humor y tardados. Y lo peor. Me robaron equipo de mi iphone dentro de la habitación, la señora de la limpieza. No se hicieron responsables y la actitus del gerente fatal. Obviamente ya nunca regresaré. Ya nunca me sentiré seguro ahí

title: Very unique hotel close to Central Park
text: Get surprised when you enter the Lobby - it's nothing like you experienced before. It feels like indoor urban gardening and you feel connected to Central Park instantly because of all ist greens. Additionally very coureous, really friendly staff wherever you go.

title: Great Birthday trip w Daughter
text: Lovely room and service was incredible. A wonderful location for shopping and seeing shows The staff was friendly, professional and responsive to any need. The restaurant, Jams, was one of our favorite dining experiences.

title: Fantastic
text: Stayed for our 10 year anniversary. Arrived to a bottle of Prosecco and a box of macarons. The room was very comfortable and the staff were always friendly and helpful. Hotel was a block away from Central Park. Would stay here again.

title: Gorgeous hotel one block from Central Park
text:
Our room was awesome. Everything is brand new. Decor throughout the hotel is based on elements of nature and looks great. 

Friendly staff. 

Restaurant was great. Nice atmosphere and the food was solid. 

Subway and Central Park right around the corner. Easy access to grab the F train. 

Lots of coffee and food shops near by.

title: It is one of the best hotels on the best hotels I have seen.
text: I am traveling a lot and I am operating more than 60 hotels. So let’s say I know what you can do wrong or false. In the case of 1Hotel Central Park I would say I couldn’t do it better. If you like to be cared in a unagitated way you have to go to this place!

title: Lovely Hotel
text: Fantastic convenient hotel with great staff and an excellent breakfast Rooms wonderfully clean but open plan toilet questionable I would definitely recommend to friends Can’t understand why review has to be 200 words when I can say all I need in 128

title: Too expensive
text: It was the worst experience I ever had. The room has enough quality but not worth paying compared to the other hotels at the same price range. I do not recommend this hotel. There seemed to be some efforts by the hotel to justify the price, like free apple and aroma in the lobby, but it was not fascinating for me. I agree some people would love that kind of fancy things, but I would not.

title: Not Worth the Price Tag
text:
Its was our 15th anniversary weekend and my wife really wanted to stay here because of their green initiatives.   I hesitantly booked a Central Park Suite as it only clocked in at 450 square feet for $1400 a night, which would have put us any of the nicest hotels in the city.   Reading several reviews on Trip Advisor about the simply superb service, I came into the weekend with high expectations for service and reasonable expectations on the accommodations.   

We arrived at the hotel at 1:45, knowing check in was not until 3pm, hoping the room would be ready, but it was not and that was fine.   We were told that we'd be given a call when the room was ready and went out to grab some lunch.   We had a 6:30 dinner reservation to celebrate, so we snacked here and there and returned to the front desk at 3:45 never having received a phone call.   At 3:45 the Front Desk told us that the room was clean and just needed to be inspected and it would be 10 more minutes.   OK, I understand,  As I was walking away I thought I heard confirmation that housekeeping had just gotten into the room, but I gave the woman at the front the desk the benefit of doubt.   At 4:05 my wife started asking me to complain (she is 8.25 months pregnant and really wanted to rest before dinner) but I gave them another 10 minutes and at 4:15, the room was indeed finally ready.   I understand sh*t happens - maybe the last guest stayed way past the Noon check out etc...  What I did not appreciate was being lied to that the room simply just needed to be inspected.

When we unloaded the car at 1:45, they took our bags but never gave us a claim ticket, so they asked me to describe our 4 bags and told us they'd be right up.   At 4:25 we called to check where the bags were and they said they were on their way.   At 4:35 we called again, and they were still on their way.  At 4:45 I was getting angry and finally someone knocked on the door with a cart of "not our" bags.   He was very apologetic and said he would be right back with them and I insisted to come with him, so this debacle of check in process could finally be over.   Upon being taken down to the 3rd floor, I went into a room with an unmade bed and towels all over the floor - a dirty room that they were using for bag storage and identified our luggage and bellman took them up, and finally just before 5pm we had our room and our luggage.   The bellman asked if we had been to the hotel before, and I said it was out first time to which we replied "Oh man, I am sorry" .  

At 6:15 we came down to leave for dinner and asked if the house car could take us to 53rd and Lexington to which they said yes, and it would be 5 minutes.   10 minutes later we asked the doorman to please check in and see if they were close, and for some reason he was hesitant to make the call, finally making it at 6:28 and the car was still 5 minutes away.   So we hopped in a cab at 6:30 for our 6:30 anniversary dinner.    Superb Service huh ?

The rest of our stay was uneventful.   The room was very nice, the bed very comfortable, but that doesn't make a hotel stand out.   My wife, who wanted to come for the green initiatives was disappointed that despite hanging our towels on the hook to be re-used, we got new towels at cleaning and turn down and that bathroom products were far from environmentally friendly.  She loved the Fall decor, but agreed it was not worth the price.

All in all, it was an average stay but again not worth the price tag compared to other luxury hotels that address you by name and do not miss one detail of  the superb service and hospitality once can expect in Manhattan.  Its a great location but we left disappointed.

title: Great location; quiet hotel
text: I love the eco consciousness of the hotel. The hotel smells wonderful, service is top notch, restaurant is great. Most of all, the bed is comfortable, the shower is awesome and the AC and heat are whisper quiet!!!

title: Great hotel in the heart of Manhattan
text: We were in NY for 5 days and stayed at 1 Hotel Central Park. The hotel is in a great location. We walked to and from the theater district easily.The subway is close by. And Of course Central Park is across the street.  From check-in to check-out the service is outstanding and so welcoming. The rooms are well appointed. Really, we loved everything about this hotel. Will we stay here again? Yes, unless we try the 1 Hotel in Brooklyn next time.

title: BEST HOTEL EVER!!!!!
text: I have not one single negative thing to say about this hotel! Every single person that works there is AMAZING!! Every detail of the hotel is thought through to be green. The room was beautiful. The food downstairs at Jams was awesome. I cannot stress how impressed I was with the staff! Literally the best hotel stay I have EVER HAD!!!

title: Undescribable
text: Literally one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Everything was incredible from the moment we stepped into the hotel, til the moment we left. The staff are extremely attentive and very sweet. The hotel always smells great. I cannot say enough about this hotel. They will definitely be seeing us again.

title: Spectacular Experience!
text:
Right from the beginning to check out, 1 Hotels’ staff & service was top notch. We had come here to celebrate my wife’s birthday & the team at 1 Hotel made sure that they could fulfill all the customizations or special requests we had asked for. 

I would definitely recommend this hotel to people who are in for a great hospitality experience & want to have walking access to 5th Avenue, Broadway, Shopping district, etc.

title: Nice hotel.
text: The best thing about this hotel is the fragrance when you walk in and their hand soap, shower gel and lotion.  It's awesome.  The rooms are very small and I've slept in more comfortable beds.  I was at the end of the hallway so it was quiet.  It's a great location if you want to be near 5th Ave.  The staff was great.

title: ❤️
text:
THE BEST!!!
Love it !
Un hotel súper trendy increíble. 
Los cuartos son increíbles súper acogedores. La atención es muy amable. El lobby es padrisimo y huele delicioso.
El restaurante es riquisimo y tiene una barra para tomar drinks muy divertida

title: Great Stay!
text: We stayed at the 1 Hotel in South Beach which we loved so when work required us to go to New York and found out that the 1 Hotel Central Park was close to our meeting, we decided to try it.  We loved all the eco-friendly touches of 1 Hotel.  Although not as nice as the south beach hotel, the central park location was ideal and the staff excellent.  We encountered massive traffic jams due to UN and Trump visit so taxi had to drop us off about 9 blocks from hotel - we walked rest of way with our luggage.  This hotel is about 2 blocks from Trump tower so whenever Trump is visiting, they have to close off several blocks around Trump tower so it took us 1.5 hours to get to our hotel.  Be aware when scheduling going and coming from airport. We stayed in room 1420 and had great views (a sliver of a view of central park and city views).  Beds were comfortable and bathrooms large and clean.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Great stay!
text: Four night stay.....beautiful place, everything worked, every single staff, including phone contacts, were friendly and helpful. Concierge was patient and thoughtful, and gave great, specific recommendations. Recommended!

title: Unique, comfort, luxury
text: Gorgeously decorated; industrial but natural with lots of plants and wood. Excellent service, comfortable rooms, attention to detail. Bar/restaurant was also beautiful and delicious...in room breakfast was fantastic (pastries and best parfait of my life). Highly recommend!

title: Perfect spot, hip, green, incredible staff
text: I stay here for business and always have a quiet room and impeccable service.  But the restaurant and bar are lively and it's a block from the park and all the attractions for visitors.  The whole place smells quietly of cedar and vetiver, it's full of reclaimed wood and planted sustainable greenery.  Very chic but not tragically hip.  It's my favorite hotel  💚

title: LOVE this gorgeous, eco-conscious hotel!
text: I work in sustainability so always delighted to see authentic sustainability initiatives in action. 1 Hotel nails it while providing a warm and luxurious home in NYC. Bed is comfortable, amenities wonderful. 2nd floor gym and conference room area is gorgeous. They even provide Tesla car service for area near hotel (mostly walkable but nice if it was raining or didn't want to walk). I will be staying here for all my future trips to the Big Apple.

title: 1 Hotel Central Park - NYC
text: Perfection in all aspects!!  They even gave me a bottle of Prosecco and a jam cake to help me celebrate my birthday weekend. The staff was warm, friendly and extremely helpful.  We even got to ride in the Tesla!!  Very cool!!

title: Wow!  What a hotel experience
text:
We just popped into this unique hotel to check it out for a future stay and were greeted by Michael B. He graciously showed us around and told us “the story” of the extremes they go to to be green. With a total lack of plastic and synthetic building materials, the lobby has a lovely scent!
We booked Sunday brunch for ourselves and two guests and had an amazing experience. Our guests, who are locals, we’re thrilled to find a unique brunch spot a block from Fifth Ave and Central Park.
Warning:  BYOB (bring your own bananas). Everything is sourced locally!
Drop in and ask for Michael. His enthusiasm will make you want to amp up your green game!

title: If I have to be away from home, I'm thrilled to stay at the 1 Hotel....
text: I travel to New York once to twice monthly on business and I've had my fair share of hotel stays at other brand hotels.  One thing that cannot be denied is the amazing hospitality at the 1 Hotel. From the moment you enter the hotel lobby, the space feels familiar with the smiling faces and warm greetings.  Not too mention, the intoxicating smell of the lobby, so fresh and so clean.  I love the 1 Hotel, it's my home away from home.  And the staff is absolutely amazing.. I usually check in closer to midnight and when I arrive one of my most favorite people greets me in the lobby, with a familiar welcome.. He remembers my name, gives me a huge smile and asks me if I need anything before I head up to my room.  As soon as I get the room, I'm instantly in my element, comfortable bedding, relaxing lights, and the fresh clean scent of the 1 Hotel.  I can go on and on about this hotel, but it's best for travelers to truly experience not only the exceptional service but a great space to hang out.  Oh and by the way, the restaurant is great, try the kale salad..

title: Every detail amazing
text: Stayed at the hotel for a 4 day workshop and enjoyed every minute period from the moment you set foot in the lobby you know this place is special. The décor features all recycled and re purposed materials and it smells great! I loved the farm to table locally sourced food. Enjoyed hanging out at the bar which has a really great selection of cocktails. The Room was small but super comfortable. The service was always pleasant.

title: Beautiful Hotel with Very Calming Interior
text:
I stayed at 1 Hotel during a very hot and humid week in July while on a work trip in New York.
