The rooms were clean and bright, it even had a window seat with pillows and cushions to look over the city streets.  The room was very quiet and equip with plenty of bathroom amenities, a nice radio and plenty of closet space. The shower was awesome!  The concierge recommended a great restaurant across the street and some nice bars to go out to afterwards as well.  The restaurant in the hotel had fresh cocktails and a great cheese plate.  We loved the location of the hotel and were able to walk to many nearby attractions(Central Park and lots of great shopping)  We will most definitely be staying at this property again.

title: A beautiful hotel in every way
text:
I visit NYC fairly regularly for business and personal reasons.  I've stayed in a variety of hotels and in different parts of the city.  
This most recent visit introduced me to the 1 Hotel on 6th Ave at 58th St.  
I was so pleased with the room and the feel of the property.  The staff is welcoming and extremely friendly as well as helpful.
Concierge, Spencer, helped with dinner reservations as well as transportation and he has to be the friendliest and most knowledgeable guy I've ever met in the city. 
The restaurant at the hotel, Jams, is awesome as well.  Under the leadership of celebrity chef, Jonathan Waxman, the staff provided farm to table dishes that were killer!
This hotel has all the warmth and class I could ask for and it's not stuffy, in fact quite the opposite.  The color scheme reflects the mission of the hotel to protect the environment and all the repurposed and recycled elements are just grand.
I loved this hotel and I'll definitely stay here again.

title: Kudos on a Healthy & Inspired Hotel!
text: As a seasoned biz traveler, I put a premium on service, ambience & sustainability - 1 Hotel Central Park has it all! From the moment you walk in, you know you are in a totally welcoming environment: eco, friendly and inspiring. The staff was beyond accommodating, food was creative, healthy & yummy and the room was incredibly inventive & welcoming. It was a treat for the eyes and senses. They really thought of everything - even the key is recyclable. I am completely hooked and have spread the word to my friends and colleagues as well.

title: Vibrant and well located
text:
Excellent location mid town a block away from The Park. 
The urban decor match the brand promise, and the restaurant across the tiny lobby area is very busy with locals. 
Staff is young and friendly. Rooms display a sense of urban chic and are very well designed. Beds are comfy and I liked the little recess by the window with blanket and plush cushions to watch the city scene below or read a book. 
Mini bar is stocked with fancy snacks and drinks...too pricey though to indulge!
Restaurant prices was on high side too - I guess this this NY after all- and food and service was good. 
Gym well equipped with natural daylight. Once you are told about their app, everything comes much easier.

title: My Favourite Hotel in New York
text: I never write reviews because of insanely busy business/travel schedule but 1 hotel made me stop because of the consistent kindness, humility and excellence of the staff, I could not fault one interaction in the whole week I stayed, Christopher, Wesley and every staff member are like a genuinely thoughtful family looking after you, when traveling far from home on your own it feels like coming home here not another work trip. This is before the design, philosophy, thought and care in every detail. The wonder of having fresh farm menu everyday from Jams restaurant they’ve nailed the menu. I rebook time and time again because these guys have created heaven on earth in New York as far as hotels go. Every detail of the rooms are designed brilliantly the space has been meticulously thought through, textures of cloth, plants, wood, nature, whole sustanable philipisophy is committed and a role model for the future of hotels. Much Praise where much praise is due.Thank you for looking after me like my own.

title: Awesome Experience
text:
Had a staycation in the city and it was wonderful. Our concierge Spencer Howard hooked it up.
Ask for him and he will take incredible care of you. 
We ate dinner at the restaurant in the lobby. They offer an amazing menu of food and drinks.

Will definitely return!

title: Amazing stay and wonderful service from Spencer
text: I recently stayed at the 1 Hotel Central Park with my boyfriend for my birthday. The hotel had a great atmosphere and the staff was super friendly. In particular, Spencer, a senior concierge at the hotel went out of his way to make our stay extra special. His service was top notch and I will definitely be making a return trip. Additionally, we had dinner at Jams (the restaurant, by Jonathan Waxman, in the hotel) and the service/food/wine was wonderful.

title: New go to hotel in NYC
text: I recently stayed at the 1hotel in Central Park for my birthday weekend. From the moment we arrived the staff was so friendly and accommodating. When I was checking in the staff asked me what my plans were and I told them I was here for my birthday and that I was looking for a nice upscale Vegan location for dinner for one evening. While I was settling into my room I got a knock and a bottle of Prosecco with a lovely note was delivered along with recommendations to some vegan restaurants. I was blown away that the staff listened to me and went above and beyond to make my birthday extra special. The concierge was so helpful and booked my birthday dinner at an amazing restaurant. I will definitely be back to this hotel for all my stays in NY!

title: Cool Hotel
text: Came for one night & stayed in a City King room. Was really nice & chic. Hotel atmosphere is relaxed and cool, smells really good. The staff was lovely, we didn't eat at the restaurant but we used the Valet service & no complaints. Location is awesome, walking distance to great stores. Would come back for sure.

title: Disappointing stay
text: We visit New York City frequently and have always stayed at 1 Hotel Central Park with a one-time exception because we love it so much. Our most recent visit, we booked a smaller room, because we are hardly ever in the room as it is. This stay was awful. The room was incredibly tiny (no room for our suitcases and walking room) and there was apparently some type of construction going on in the entire building surrounding our room, which we *should have* been told about and made aware of. There were constant drilling, sawing, and hammering noises going on at literally all hours. You could hear every little noise from the other rooms and the halls. There was always a horrible smell in the elevator. Typically, we love coming here because it is so relaxing, but this was definitely our last time staying here.

title: Bait and Switch
text:
We booked an Alcove King because we specifically needed the seating area that is advertised on the website for this room. The floor plan drawing and the 360 degree view for the Alcove King clearly show two chairs and an ottoman at the area at the foot of the bed. When we were finally able to check in late in the afternoon (even though we arrived hours earlier) we discovered they had given us a room with no seating area--just a wall at the foot of the bed, several feet short of what was advertised. When we called the front desk to rectify the situation, instead of apologizing they tried to play it off as if WE were somehow confused. We looked on the website and double checked the confirmation and they were wrong. By this time, we were running late for our evening plans and didn't have time to keep arguing as they were clearly giving us the run around. The next day we received no follow up, no offer to switch us to the correct room or any price adjustment but they did send a complimentary bag of granola to our room. 

We've stayed in so many nice hotels in NYC and this is not one of them. The room was dark, the finishes seem cheap, the amenities lacking and our sink had a huge crack. The worst part was the large window (that faces a brick wall) was absolutely caked with bird/animal droppings. I know this is New York City and you can't expect everything to be pristine, but this was just gross. The ledge is at eye level with the bed--inches from your head when you lay down.The only thing to do is to lower the curtain, which won't lower all the way because of all the plants along the sill. 

I know this hotel purports to be environmentally friendly, but with the dishonesty over the room size, how can you trust anything they say? This is the second review on Trip Advisor recently that has complained about the bait-and-switch, so I know it's not just us. Don't let it happen to yo

title: Site Inspection
text: The guestrooms were beautiful - loved the natural wood throughout the hotel.  Shower was wonderful with good bath products.  The meeting space was also nice - would be great for a smaller - mid size business meeting.  Jams Restaurant was also nice.

title: Great hotel!!
text: The hotel is so cute and the staff all very friendly. The concierge, Spencer, was very helpful in making recommendations for dinner plans. My favorite part was when checking out, it was raining and we had no umbrellas, the front desk staff was opening a large box of umbrellas and gave us two, complimentary! We appreciated this thoughtful touch very much! Would love to visit again next time we’re in NYC.

title: the hotel is good, the concierge is great
text: the hotel is great, no problems with it...I don't really love the proximity of the bathroom to the bedroom and the fact that the whole wall is glass, but other than that, it's a new, polished and green establishment. Very cool hotel. But, what made the stay all that much better was the help of Spencer and the rest of the Concierge team. They were response, helpful, insightful, and that began before our stay and last even after we had checked out. Can't say enough good things about those guys.

title: Great hotel and staff!
text: I do not normally write reviews, but what a gem! Could not have asked for a better stay here. The location is perfect as you are right by Central Park. Josh with the facial hair was extremely helpful and the rest of the front desk seemed to really enjoy their job. Housekeeping were super nice and very attentive. I will be back for sure!

title: Great hotel 1 block from Central Park
text:
Extremely well designed, rooms and amenities are modern and rustic at the same time.... eco friendly and the location can not be better.
The staff friendly and efficient, and they seem to be enjoying their work which is great.
Congrats to all involved !!!

title: Thank You To  Michael Huynh
text: Thank you to 1 Hotel Central Park for their exceptional service and attention in helping our store, The Lake Forest Shop, 265 E Market Square, Lake Forest, IL.  Needed help shipping trunk show boxes and Michael Huynh went above and beyond to personally deliver to UPS.  Our trunk show would have been a disaster without him.  What a fabulous hotel and staff.  Highly recommend it!!!

title: Awful customer service
text: Stayed here for five nights during December. Hotel itself is OK (although dark and the bathrooms lack any privacy), and the restaurant Jams is actually lovely, but the service we received was atrocious. During our stay we were left with a batch of "clean" laundry which was covered in blood - and I mean covered - for which we received no reassurance that the towels were just heavily stained and not someone else's bloodied towel from another room. Neither did we receive an apology. On check out a manager did show some concern and agreed to provide us with a refund off our bill as a gesture of goodwill. The refund was processed but entirely unknown to me (until my credit card bill arrived), the hotel had credited the refund back to themselves again a few days later. Our travel agent sorted this for us and we were refunded for a second time. However ten days later, the same thing happened - they took their money back again. Using my credit card details TWICE without my consent is simply unacceptable but, it would appear, not worthy of an apology as we have heard nothing from the hotel since by way of explanation or apology. Overall, a bad experience we won't be repeating.

title: Deliberately Misled
text:
We booked a couples retreat stay with this hotel, but can't help but feel bait-and-switched.

We reserved a "city king room" for a short stay in the city. Upon arriving, we asked if it would be possible to do an early check-in. Michael, who helped us, said that it was, but that the only room available was an ADA compliant "city king room". We sounded a little bit unsure, but he stressed several times that the only difference between this and the non-ADA compliant room was that some shelving were lower and that there were some handles in the room to assist with mobility. Sounds like minor differences right? Wrong.

The floorplan was completely different. The nice shower you see in published photos for the "city king room"? Replaced with a much less interesting one. The nice window nook that they advertise on the site was completely gone and replaced with a simple sill with some plants. Moreover, there was a gigantic and extremely intrusive steel pillar in the middle of the room. Maybe these things don't seem like too big a deal, but the nice shower and the window nook were my drivers in choosing this hotel over others. Yes, there were handles for mobility and the desk was a little lower, but I can't help but feel like the other differences were deliberately and conveniently withheld from me - I just don't buy that he didn't know about the other differences.

Add that to the $50 early arrival fee they charged me, I cant help but feel a little bit jerked around.

Please avoid the ADA room, despite whatever assurances they might give you.

title: A Sustainable Hip Boutique Hotel
text: This was my first stay at this hotel. We choose the hotel for the great location and their focus on sustainability. From the moment you step into the lobby you get a feeling this small hotel is different. The hotel is modern with an earthy bent with wood, plants and natural decorations. They have used reclaimed wood and artifacts to decorate the halls, lobby and rooms. The halls have moss strips at he doorways that somehow makes you feel good as you walk by. The service was excellent and the location 1/2 block from the start of central park cannot be beat for a show weekend. The restaurant is hip and inviting and the service was excellent. The breakfast was top notch and they had options for vegans and carnivores alike. The bar at night is lively and the beer and drinks were all excellent. The rooms are typical for a NYC hotel. If you can, ask for a room with a bay window seating area. This was my favorite place to lounge around when in the room. I will stay at this hotel again soon.

title: Arrogance, pretentious and no respect to customers
text: Stayed here on business. The Hotel pretends that it is eco friendly but totally forgets that it is charging a lot of money and should offer service. Had breakfast next to a table where a kitchen staff meeting was taking place and heard all the details about rubbishy collection. Had an accident at the entrance where a piece of metal ripped my shoe and the so called “Manager on duty” refused to even acknowledge the problem let alone compensate for the damage. Arrogance and attitude is what characterized a really bad stay.

title: Lovely
text: Definitely coming back. The vibe was warm and relaxed. The attention to detail was also extraordinary. And the alcove was the perfect place for a cup of coffee and a good book on a Saturday morning. The restaurant Jams was great for a cocktail before heading out for a big dinner. Lovely

title: America's Best Concierge
text: Hotel 1 Park Avenue is excellent.  Spencer Howard, the hotel's concierge, provided outstanding service.  Spencer made dinner reservations and arranged theater tickets for me.  Spencer can do things that other concierges cannot.  Hotel 1 Park Avenue has a very eco-friendly vibe.

title: Beautiful hotel!
text: Really enjoyed a quick trip in the city with a stay at this hotel. Gorgeous room, gorgeous lobby and really friendly staff. The lobby bar and restaurant was also quite lovely. I usually stay around the corner at the Ritz but this may be my new go to! Lovely view of Central Park through 914.

title: Excellet service
text: The people of hotel is very cool. The hotel is nice and very clean. The location is great and easy to move to everywhere. The restaurant Jams is very good and the concierge did many things for us. Really is good hotel

title: Bellissimo Hotel // Ottima esperienza !
text:
Design bellissimo, pulizia eccezionale, personale gentilissimo e disponibile, ristorante di ottima qualità e camere silenziose. Senza dubbio il miglior hotel di New York ! Consigliato per un’esperienza eccezionale nella Big Apple, in coppia o in famiglia. Noi avevamo una camera con vista mozzafiato sulla City! 

Thank you guys for such a good experience, I’ll be back soon !

title: Eco Friendly in the Heart of Manhattan
text: Awesome hotel one block south of Central Park.  The room designs are very well thought out.  Earthy, warm, modern, and clean.  Super friendly staff. Cozy lobby and restaurant.  Love the window seats overlooking the City and Central Park - especially on the Northwest side of the hotel.  Definitely, recommend!

title: Peccato la camera con vista toilette!!!
text:
Bella struttura e buona la posizione vicino alla fermata della metro. Personale gentile. In camera tante cose inutili e poco igieniche: tappeti, cuscini, piante, coperte, soprammobili, libri ecc. Mancano invece le ciabatte. Terribile  il water accanto al letto. 
Buona la colazione ma forse un po cara (nel locale affianco si mangia benissimo e si spende la metà)

title: NYC Retreat
text: This place is great! It’s tough to eat and live healthily while traveling on business. Everything about this place, just South of Central Park, exudes Mother Nature. It actually feels like a bit of a retreat from the natural decor to the restaurant which is all farm to table. I highly recommend 1 Hotel!

title: Amazing stay in NYC!
text: I loved everything about my stay here! I felt welcomed from the second I walked in. Dan was great and helped with my bags and walked me to the front desk. Michael at the front desk was also super helpful and was even able to get me checked in early! The hotel is beautiful and in the perfection location. I hope to be back soon!!!

title: Amazing Hotel and Staff!!!
text: I was recommended this hotel by a former co-worker and it did not disappoint! I stayed here for a week while relocating from Southern California to NYC. The staff (especially Richard Branch) made my stay feel like a second home. Richard's knowledge of the city was extremely helpful. While apartment hunting, multiple staff members were eager to give me their opinions/recommendations of areas. Richard  went the extra mile of compiling a "Welcome to the Neighborhood" email which outlined; restaurants, markets, banking, fitness etc. to help me acclimate once I left the hotel. Because of this unparalleled experience, my family and friends cannot wait to visit and stay at this amazing hotel. Especially because it's steps away from Central Park, 5th Avenue, and Time Square (it's close to transit, and they have a Tesla available to guests). Not to mention it's chic/earthy modern design left my Instagram followers drooling ;) Thank you all for the amazing experience, I truly will never forget it!!!!

title: Excellent hôtel au cœur de Manhattan
text:
Super hôtel au cœur de Manhattan. A quelques encablures de Central Park, 5th Avenue, Time Square... bref, au centre de New York !
Cadre « naturel » très agréable. Petit déjeuner copieux et un service au top ! On apprécie le personnel aux petits soins et les chaussettes pour avoir chaud la nuit !
Enfin, certaines chambres ont une petite alcôve donnant sur la rue... avec Central Park au bout, le rêve !

title: Best Wedding Proposal Ever
text: I planned proposing to my boyfriend with the amazing help of Spencer, one of the concierges. He went above and beyond, helping me think through not only many of the details of the actual proposal but helped me continue the surprise at multiple locations throughout our evening. Jams, the hotel bar, is amazing locally sourced food and we had a delicious drink with a very nice bartender. The room we stayed in was both masuline and sexy with a great view of nearby buildings. The entire staff made our stay incredibly memorable. Oh, and he said YES!!

title: Outstanding customer service!
text: Chester and the whole team went above and beyond to ensure I was comfortable! Chester went so far as to hand deliver a gift for me with a hand written card. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone!

title: Weekend trip with my girlfriend
text: Surprised my girlfriend with a trip to NY. The woman at the front desk ((antigonia?) sorry I’m horrible with names )upgraded our room complimentary and also sent up a bottle of Prosecco which was really awesome! We had brunch at the restaurant on the lobby floor which was good ( order the French toast) the staff was also friendly the concierge helped us with dinner reservations. The window bed was nice when we were in the room warming up. Hotel is near 5th ave if you’re going to Ny to shop and across the street from Central Park. Definitely will recommend to our friends. We can’t wait to try the location in Miami!

title: Amazing stay!
text: This hotel is located in a perfect position, just a block away from Central Park on the Avenues of the Americas. The hotel is very modern (offering a cool and hip vibe to your stay) with an urban touch and is also eco-friendly since everything is inspired by mother nature (most of the hotel is surrounded by green plants and thoughtful touches of nature and is designed using recyclable materials). Rooms have reclaimed wood accents and come with free Wi-Fi, flat-screen TV, Nespresso machine, mini bar, yoga mats, a bay window sitting area and a 24/7 room service. The shower, the warm socks and hoodie robe were a definite plus. Bedding is very comfortable, rooms are very well soundproofed and very well cleaned. Staff is just phenomenal. Young, dynamic, competent and going above and beyond the call of duty. I was upgraded to a superior room free of charge because the first room they attributed to me was a bit noisy due to the AC. I have nothing but rave reviews for this hotel. I highly recommend it!

title: still a unique experience in nyc
text: back 3 years after my first stay at the 1 hotel...and no change, it is still a quite unique hotel in NYC; small, cosy, welcoming, warm, charm, eco-friendly, healthy food, friendly staff, boutique hotel...we are very far from the traditional nyc hotel: big, noisy and without any customised service; from now on, it is definitely my base when travelling to NYC

title: Beautiful hotel and unbelievable Concierge.
text: My friend and I decided to do a little staycation at the 1 hotel Central Park on our day off from work. The second we entered the lobby we felt we were being taken care of. The staff was all so kind and accommodating to anything and everything we needed. We wanted to extend a particular thank you to their unbelievable concierge Spencer Howard. He helped make our stay feel especially personobal and special. The details in every part of the hotel, from lobby, to room, to even the hallways. Spectacular. Highly recommend!

title: Home away From Home
text: I am a born and raised New Yorker ( now residing in suburbs) and frequently stay at the One Hotel for business and family visits. The entire staff , from the front desk, valets, restaurant , housekeeping, all contribute to making my stay 100% enjoyable.It is for me my home away from home !

title: Home away from home
text: Where every details matters. From the front desk service to the room comfort, 1 hotel central park is unparalleled & unrivalled. At the end of my stay I felt like I was leaving home and going back away.

title: Our tradition
text:
Every year we come to NYC from San Francisco to catch a few shows . We have tried a few hotels and have decided that 1hotel Central Park is the only place we will stay going forward. We are a family of three, my daughter is 16. We love the family suite we get every year because it helps us restore in our own space after busy city days and evenings. My daughter has her own room and bathroom adjoined to ours , she can stay up a bit later and her suitcase explosion won’t bother us in the least. The rooms are comfy and eco friendly . It is really important to us to be able to completely unwind in our hotel space and we always do at 1 hotel . The concierge staff are top notch and elevate your stay beyond expectations! You will see the same faces year after year , because it is a warm and welcoming place ,the employees enjoy what they do and clearly are treated well.
Thank you 1 hotel for making our tradition so special year after year!!

title: Must Stay next for NYC
text:
What a location !! this location is central to my business area and convenience by any transportation  to any location of Manhattan
Super friendly staffs took us at the last minute, my office booked the wrong hotel which is not a pet-friendly, But 1 Hotel make it happened when we are just one hour away to arrival NYC with last minute.
Check-in cannot be more easy and friendly
First-time stay and this ONE Hotel is on my top one list for next time "MUST"

title: Excellent hotel, will stay here again next time when I visit New York
text: The hotel is designed with Nature concept, full with trees, woods and plants. Very pleasant feeling staying in the room, lobby and dining area. Location is perfect, few minutes walks to Central Park and 5th Avenues for shopping. Hotel staff is very welcoming and provides very good service. The food in the dining place , James restaurant, serves good breakfast, lunch and dinner. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent hotel, sustainable practices
text: Great stay, especially for our dogs! Staff is wonderful and friendly. I love 1Hotels for the greenery and sustainable practices with perfectly upcycled decor. This is my favorite hotel, so relaxing! Comfortable beds and furniture. They welcome pets, and provide beds, toys, and treats. Our dogs loved staying here as much as Hubby and I do, they were so excited to have these items provided in the room. We ordered dinner from room service, our meals were excellent! We originally cancelled the reservation with weather concerns, and the manager was flexible although we were outside the cancellation period. So glad we decided to rebook and chance the weather driving home.

title: LOVE this hotel!
text:
My husband and I go in the city all the time and decided to stay near Central Park this time. From the time we checked in we knew we made the right choice! Every detail has been thought. The amazing fragrance as you walk in the hotel lobby is incredible ~ a natural, woodsy scent that greets upon check in and stays with you throughout your stay. You feel like home but better! Love all the natural elements, proximity to the park and the cozy window box seat was my favorite place to sip nespresso (yes it's in the room!) and watch the world go by with the Park and San Remo view. 
Thank you to everyone at Hotel 1!

title: Da tenere in considerazione!
text:
Hotel molto molto carino proprio dietro Central Park...fermata metro subito sotto l’hotel e bar/ristorante buono! 
Unica pecca le camere molto molto piccole! 
Comunque da tenere in considerazione per 2/3 giorni!

title: NYE weekend
text: My second stay with 1 Hotels, first was Miami Beach location. Central Park location was convenient to all, very clean and actually quiet! Slept great!! Housekeeping was extremely efficient and attentive, as were all hotel staff. Loved free fresh fruit in lobby each day, all day. I’d definitely recommend this hotel. Would give 5 stars if gym was a bit better.

title: Beautiful and unique hotel- will be back!
text: I stayed here this past weekend and was blown away! It is a gorgeous hotel and has a very earthy/natural feel throughout. Maryam checked us in and was very helpful. There are gorgeous plants and natural decor (including ivy on the outside so you can't miss it) and they use all reclaimed materials. We had some cocktails, beers and small plates at their restaurant and they were spectacular and the service was fantastic. The restaurant manager, Jeffrey, and the bartenders gave us great recommendations (you can't go wrong with their cocktails). The location is great, right next to Central Park. Our room was very impressive, the shower was beautiful and it had a great nook that overlooked the street. Overall, our stay was perfect and I'll definitely be back!

title: Extra Pics of Park King
text: Some extra pics of the view from our Park King following a request.  Great hotel, can only hope to visit again.  The view from our kids room a City View Queen wasn’t that much worse. Photos don’t really do it justice as the window seat in the afternoon was great.

title: Best Staycation Ever!
text: Our stay at the 1 Hotel Central Park was an absolute dream! Spencer at the concierge desk was incredibly welcoming and very helpful in securing us a dinner reservation at a fantastic restaurant nearby. We got delicious cocktails and small plates at the bar, and John the bartender was wonderfully hospitable. The hotel itself is an oasis in the middle of midtown, and the room service breakfast in bed from Jams was excellent. We'll be back for sure!

title: Great location but probably wouldn't rush to return
text:
This is a hard one.  I wouldn't discourage anyone from staying here if wanting a mid-town hotel but I would not return again on the next trip.  More things irritated us than impressed us.  

The main drawcard is of course the great location and as a lover of all things Scandi I felt the decor in the foyer had that sort of vibe and a fresh 'woodlands' smell - so we really just loved that aspect in particular.  The other thing I really enjoyed was the smell of the great products in the bathroom.

The less impressive however.....

After departing they charged us $15 for mini bar consumption yet we hadn't consumed anything.  We raised it with them and it was refunded so that was fine, but irritating because it meant overseas transaction fees on our credit card for no fault of ours!  On that note, what is weird with the mini bar is there are no glasses (wine, tumbler or otherwise) to use even IF you wanted to consume something from the fridge.  Weird!!!
 
Our 'suite' had zero view whatsoever.  Not every room is going to be lucky enough to have a good view I know, but paying much more than a standard room and having a view out over an aircon system isn't great!  Incidentally the sound from that system was tolerable for us - we note others say it is really loud but we didn't notice it.  Also, yes this is Manhattan, but for a suite there was next to no room to move.

The resort fee:  a permanent grumble of ours with all hotels.  Don't tell us that all these things you 'get' are included or complimentary when you pay a daily fee for them!! 

Our family members received turn-down each evening in their room.  We had a higher priced room, if that meant anything, and never once had turn-down.  Also, be aware if you like your privacy that the glass bathroom doors, even with the screen pulled, leave a little to be desired!  

Finally, during our stay we needed an ice bucket on three occasions.  Two out of the three times we had to follow-up either by phone or in person downstairs as it didn't turn up despite being told it would be sent 'immediately' every time.  Once we simply couldn't wait any longer and had to leave for our dinner and put a note on the door to ask them to enter and leave the ice inside.   For a five star hotel that's pretty hopeless.

title: Needs Improvement, Location Still Good
text:
We reviewed 1 Hotel over 2 years ago.  We had a great stay then, and the hotel was new.  We've also stayed with 1 Hotel a few times since then.  But during this last trip, we had a few problems that we hope will be addressed, so here's a new review. 

The prices have now gone up by quite a bit since two plus years ago, and the hotel is showing a little wear. 
For this recent visit we had two rooms and stayed for 5 nights, and at this cost, it wasn't cheap.

Positives
Location, location, location; friendly staff; comfy beds; good Wi-Fi.  The staff always asks if they can help (even when they can't help or don't), and they are friendly and try to assist.  They make you feel welcomed. The window seat is lovely and relaxing. 

Negatives

1.  When we arrived a little after 6 pm (really, 6 pm!) our rooms were not ready, so we had to wait in the crowded bar area.  They did give us a free glass of sparkling water, but we were tired from a day of traveling, and had to sit and wait for an hour before our room was ready.

2.  The air conditioning noise was loud in one of the rooms we were in. One of us waited in the room to show the repair person they finally sent up, but when the worker came to the room, he said the a/c unit was known to make the noises, that he could not easily repair it. There were no other rooms available that evening, so we used ear plugs.  But after one night, we were able to change rooms.  Guess what?  The new room's a/c was starting to have the same problems - it was noisy but not as loud as the previous (original) room so we just stayed in this second room.  Plus, all the packing and unpacking took up valuable time.  The noise was bearable.  So that room will also have noise problems later if the a/c problem is not looked after. 

3.  One evening we ordered dinner in the room.  The dinner didn't arrive.  After 2 hours, we called downstairs, and the lady that answered said she saw the waiter bringing up our food right then.  We waited an additional 45 minutes - valuable time, and we were hungry and wanted to do other things.  (We somehow thought room service would be relaxing and quicker.) So we called downstairs again.  They reordered the food and it arrived at least 3 hours late from our original order time.  We didn't have to pay for the food, they tried to make it right, but this should not have happened, especially after calling about the food more than once.  And we can't get the time back.  This from a 5 star hotel that charges a high rate.

4.  As a selling point in its ads, the hotel offered a free taxi to close locations in a hotel electric car, but every time we asked (3 times), the staff said, aw, they were sorry but the car wasn't available. We even tried to book the car in advance and asked when the car would be available (we could wait or be back later), but we couldn't do that either.  The staff could never tell us when the car would be back and available. Why offer a car if you're not going to truly let the customers/ visitors use it?
 
These were the biggest problems.  (We had to get the wooden key redone because it had stopped working for one of the rooms, for example, but this is minor compared to the above 4 problems.) 
Also, the construction problems outside aren't the hotel's fault (except that the room prices are so high that you'd expect better - or more reasonable rates).  And hopefully the construction will disappear soon.  But a 5 star shouldn't have these problems.  

We had such nice stays previously that we were really disappointed and hope the a/c gets fixed, the rooms are ready at 6 pm, and the staff are more efficient.  We want to like 1 Hotel again, but there were so many disappointments this one visit.

title: A warm oasis in the middle of Manhattan
text:
Took my wife and kid here for Christmas vacation. Excellent all round hotel. The service is great and we really loved the aesthetic of the whole hotel from the lobby to the rooms. It all felt very comfortable. The location is fantastic (Central Park, 5th Avenue and 57th St metro within easy walking distance). 

The restaurant was good value and we enjoyed the breakfast, staff were friendly and helped out with the 3yr old's breakfast demands! We also had dinner at Jams which stands out with it's seasonal food and well done classics.

Some things to note...the courtesy car which is available to guests on a first come first serve basis was never available...a lot of demand I'm sure...so don't count on it as a form of transport...the valet and concierge didn't seem to know where it was or when it would be back...not a big issue, but we did get excited when checking in (getting around the city with a 3yr old can be a hassle, so the car was a nice touch).

This hotel is now top of my companies list when coming to NYC for business.

title: Warm, welcoming, smells great
text: This close to Central Park hotel has great service and a unique look. Made of recycled materials, it feels warmer and more inviting than the usual cookie cutter place made of tile and plastic and glass. It smells wonderful, like cedar and wood and dirt (in a good way). The lobby and the bar were always hopping. My only suggestion would be to lose the Nespresso machine and its little polluting pods. Not sure what could take its place, but there must be something. A French press? Service was friendly, helpful, and attentive at all times.

title: Poco que añadir
text: Ubicación perfecta. Habitación muy buena y con unas buenas dimensiones para estar en NYC. Hotel muy sostenible, mucha madera y plantas naturales. Limpieza y atención muy bien. El asiento/mirador de la ventana es un punto.

title: Ótima opção
text: O hotel tem uma ótima localização, a poucos metros do Central Park e da 5• Av. O quarto não é muito grande, e no meu caso não tinha uma vista privilegiada, mas a localização e a hospitalidade dos funcionários foi impecável. A forma de comunicação com a recepção é a partir de uma canal interno de mensagens o que facilita aos que não dominam muito o idioma. Próximo ao restaurante tem ótimos restaurantes como o Benihana é ótima lojas de comércio. O hotel tem um serviço de “táxi” para levar os hóspedes até uma determinada distância!!

title: fantastic
text: we really liked this hotel. I was here on business, but got my wife to come along. this was the perfect hotel. close to everything. helpful staff. reasonably priced. super clean. charming. etc. next time I'm in NYC, I'll probably stay here.

title: Fresh, clean, friendly and convenient!
text: We were in NYC to enjoy the Christmas energy on the weekend before Christmas.  Walked around Rockefeller Plaza area, saw the lights and store windows, browsed the Columbus Circle christmas market, etc.   Close to all the fun touristy things.  The hotel is just lovely.  Emphasis on recyled and reclaimed in the decor.  The plants on the exterior and interior of the hotel add a comforting feel.  All the staff was very friendly and very accomodating.  I would definitely stay here again.  Added bonus is that there are vegan options standard on their menu.  As an ethical vegan that was a wonderful and unexpected bonus.

title: Cool Hotel in a Great Location
text:
1 Hotel Central Park is a smart little base for a trip to NY. Ideally located for Central Park, 5th Avenue and all Midtown attractions.

Our room was nice, lots of eco-friendly touches around although the rumble from the AC machines on the roof not far below our window was noticeable.  We were on floor 7.

It was small but perfectly comfortable, good shower, very comfortable bed and well stocked mini-bar... too well stocked though as we found the leftovers of a previous guests teeth whitening gel syringe in the fridge. There was also no milk for the coffee and the 1 Hotel App used for ordering room service etc... didn't work on any of our Apple devices which was annoying but the service on the end of the internal phone was excellent so no real problem.

I wouldn't class 1 Hotel Central Park as luxury but it is very cool and 'quirky', with something interesting to look at in every space. The food in Jams was good, drinks were good, the hotel staff were all very friendly and attentive and I'd consider it good value for money on the whole.

I probably wouldn't stay again, only because there is so much choice in the city that I'd like to try something else next time although I would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of visiting NYC.

title: Great hotel
text:
Modern, young and vibrant hotel in a great location near Central Park.
In walking distance to various great restaurants. The rooms are modern, clean and quite spacious (for Ney York standards) with all amenities that you could wish for. Friendly, helpful and young staff gives the place the feel that you want in a city like this.

title: Pretentious without "The Right Stuff"
text: Lots of attitude at the 1 Hotel, but follow through is not there.   Hotel lost my luggage and finally located it after a 30 minute+ search.  The front desk staff were disinterested and disorganized.  Rooms are small.  Don't bring a lot of toiletries.  No where to put them in the bathroom.  There are better properties in the area who will provide attentive service.

title: emperor's new clothes
text: I don't get it.  I see nothing particularly eco-friendly about this hotel, unless old railroad ties and stained floors and carpets are eco-friendly? Not cheap either.  Location is good though .  Breakfasts in the resto also good and staff are super nice.

title: Good energy and great location
text: We chose the 1Hotel Central Park based on its excellent location just steps away from Central Park, and it’s progressive design and eco friendly approach to hotel life. Staff were really well mannered and friendly with really good energy, the gym was well equipped albeit it small, and the overall vibe of the hotel was really cool and on trend. Jams has great social appeal for evening drinks before heading out. Rooms were neat and bedding was amazingly comfortable! Bathrooms are a little tight and not private. Housekeeping and overall service was on point. The mobile tech in the room didn’t always work effectively for purpose.  Overall Highly recommended!

title: Very Disappointed
text:
This hotel is located around the block from the Plaza and JW Marriott and seemed like a good alternative. I would say it is anything but. I booked a junior suite which is a very expensive room and found myself on a low floor with a view of nothing more than the very large and loud HVAC equipment powering this and the other buildings around that. The room itself was small, the shower door did not close fully and whenever I showered the bathroom flooded because of this. The one redeeming quality I can mention is that the bed is comfortable.

The exercise room they dub the “Field House” is small, cramped and full of equipment that is either broken or poorly positioned and difficult to use. Prime example would be their treadmills which have an awkward light bar in close proximity and directly above the running deck. If you are 6 feet or taller there is a good chance you might knock yourself unconscious if you had a little hop in your step. 

Overall I’m very disappointed in this hotel, which is the last thing I would expect at these rates. Don’t ruin your trip by staying here with high expectations.

title: HOTEL ONE CENTRAL PARK (but it’s not on the park)
text: Liked rooms. Very quiet. BUT breakfast arrangement unacceptable... guests have to compete with public for seating. Some desk people very sassy. Confirmation does not give address so hard for first time visitor to find. Bottom line will not return

title: Trendy green hotel
text: Not only are the exterior walls clad with ivy, the interior is filled with reclaimed materials, Moss and all things trendy. There was even a tray filled with apples for guests to help themselves. Really enjoyed our stay.

title: Mi aspettavo di piu '
text:
Ottimo il design di questo hotel boutique che pero ' e' molto distante dal raggiungere il massimo .... camere un po piccole , ma ok siamo a new york , ma vista improponibile , avevamo una camera al 4 piano su casa interna degna di un albergo da una stella.!!! 
D avvero pessima la vista , aria fredda inoltre che spiffera un po dai vetri ( fuori meno 5 ) ....  reception ottima   ... peccato

title: Prefect blend - hip, friendly, location, service
text: This pad is not only in a fantastic location but super unique in its style. Run incredibly well with staff that’s super helpful, the bar and restaurant is approachable and high quality and the little touches (like a Tesla car service for no charge that u used!) make it 5 star.  Give it a run - you won’t regret!

title: The Xmas shoebox
text:
The room is extremely, small and because of the road work and building extremely noisy! Traffic is not allowed to turn down the street.. Lobby is and the elevators very slow
The mimalist approach in the bedroom room works because there is no room to do. Anything! You even have to position the sliding bath door so you can open the room door to enter and exit.
They don't remove the garbage from the room on a daily basis but do replace towels if you heap them on the floor.
We used them. To. Call for a car to take us at 530am to the airport  178.00 *taxi is 55.00"we want to go to laguardia it took us to jfk.
Lot of better options. In new York that this hotel.

title: A Great Find
text: The 1 Hotel Central Park is an excellent place to stay while in New York City.  It has a great location only a couple of blocks from Central Park.  If you like to walk, this location is great.  Your can get to all areas of the City very easily. The staff are all very attuned to help you in any way they can.  The rooms are small, as most in the City, but very comfortable and nicely decorated.  There is a use of reclaimed products in all areas of this Hotel.

title: Cool hotel, right in the middle of everything NYC has to offer
text: Great design, super friendly and helpful staff. Katlyn at the front desk was fantastic. so many people at the hotel went out of their way to make my stay pleasant.  Without asking they checked to see if there was an upgrade. would definitely stay there again, and again. :)

title: Beautiful hotel with good food and good vibes
text: the hotel has one of the best locations I ever stayed in NYC. The rooms are cosy and warm, they have a super cool steamer (small an easy to use). The food is also one of the highlights very fresh natural and delicious. The staff is very fast to attend your needs. At night the restaurant/bar has a nice vibe too

title: Love this hotel
text: Every detail was amazing! Definitely a favorite. Easy walk to Central Park (and we had an amazing view from our room) great bar experience. The staff were all extremely helpful with directions and recommendations and the service was awesome.

title: Perfect New York Hotel
text: A mix of elegance and comfort is exactly what you are looking for in a boutique hotel. Location is within the perfect walk of everything that Manhattan has to offer, spend a day exploring Central Park and a day exploring 5th avenue. The downstairs restraint offers excellent snacks and with the large windows you can sip on a cocktail and watch the world go by. We were a little apprehensive of the room size before we arrived however the designs and use of light make all the room seem huge, we had a room with a window nook, that I would definitely recommend, and it was very comfortable with a good size bathroom and very comfy bed. Next time we may split our stay between downtown and the new location in Broklyn.

title: Great boutique hotel - perfect central location
text: We really enjoyed our stay during the Thanksgiving holiday.   The hotel is decorated very nicely and is modern for a NYC hotel.   The rooms are small as expected for NYC, but smartly organized.   The team is very friendly and helpful.   We brought our two cavalier King Charles Spaniels who were welcomed by the team.   We were steps from Central Park, Broadway, 5th Avenue shopping, and Lincoln Center. The Jams restaurant is great during the summer time as they have dog friendly patio dining.   We live in Ct and visit the city often with our dogs.   It is hard to find quality restaurants that allow dogs on the patio area.  The team at Jams totally welcomed our dogs and gave them some bacon as a treat.   If we ever decide to stay in the city again, we will definitely be back.

title: Tolles Hotel an bester Lage mit Nachhaltigkeit
text: Spannendes Hotel an bester Lage mit äusserst angenehmen Service. Für alle die etwas ausgefallenes mit Nachhaltigkeit suchen. Werde beim nächsten New York Besuch auf jeden Fall wieder kommen. Park, Met, Guggenheim, MoMa etc. alles zu Fuss jederzeit erreichbar.

title: Great cocktails
text:
Stopped here after a long walk in Central Park. It was a Saturday in late Autumn, so the bar and restaurant were very busy. Managed to secure a seat at the bar and I enjoyed a large beer in a jam jar shaped glass while my wife had a Bloody Mary. She had visited the hotel before and swore that the Bloody Marys were the best in NYC. 

The barman was very chatty and produced some great drinks. The 2nd cocktail contained cinnamon and coffee and was delicious. 

Glad we stopped by 😃

title: Angenehmes modernes Hotel Nahe Central Park
text: Ein modernes Hotel mit Loftcharakter und modernem ideenreichem Design, sehr viel Grün/Pflanzen, angesagte Bar/Bistro, eher junges urbanes Publikum. Das Zimmer war hell mit Ausichtung zum Central Park. Das gesamte Personal sehr kundenoetientiert und zuvorkommend. Die Lage ist ideal im Zentrum, vieles fußläufig oder per U-Bahn erreichbar.

title: Great hotel with best service in NYC
text: Best service we had during our stay in NYC. Housekeeping was always consistent and seamless, great personalized service in F&B. Guest services always professional and friendly. Special thanks to Briana at the Concierge desk for her assistance during our stay. We will come back soon !

title: Love this property!
text: Loved this hotel! Great location, room and onsite restaurant. I was there for work but would be great for families or couples as well. Meeting rooms all have windows which is essential. I like the environmental focus in the operations.

title: Great staff, nice (small) rooms and great location
text: This hotel has great staff, nice rooms with wooden floors, super clean linens and is greatly located if you like to run in Central Park in the morning. The bar/restaurant serves nice food (try the Tuna poke) and has an interesting crowd. I will definitely return on one of my next stays.

title: Beautiful Boutique Hotel with Fabulous Staff and Location!
text:
My husband and I stayed at The 1 Central Park last week,  and loved EVERYTHING about it. I am a born and bread New Yorker and work in the Hospitalty Business, so a pretty tough Hotel Critic...but I would happily send any of my clients to stay here, a fabulous weekend getaway!

Walking distance to all great 5th ave shopping, theatre distict and Central park. We even had a view of the park from our room. Great laid back vibe with the friendliest and most accommodating staff. 

Marco and Janessa in Sales Dept went above and beyond to ensure that my stay was seamless. 

We had dinner at JAMS...honestly, the BEST bread and Chicken on earth! If your not staying, you should just come to jams and have a incredible meal. 
Everyone from our waitier to the Restaurant manager were super friendly and went above and beyond catering to our every desire. Great Cocktails too..

Rooms are not huge (but a great size for NYC) but so incredibly thought out, especially loved the built in window seat where I had coffee in the morning while looking over Central Park. Appreciated and loved environmentally friendly Bathroom Amenities, in large bottles and the greatest Sweatshirt fabric bathrobe in the room...Most comfy robe ever!

title: Central Park view
text: Stayed for 2 nights in the rooms overlooking Central Park. Awesome views! Great room, worth the money. Loved the window seat. Did not get 5 stars at the 3pm checkin was delayed until 5pm. Otherwise, this place is super convenient to the park, 5th Ave shopping, etc. I would most def go back again.

title: In Love with 1 Hotel Central Park (frequent 1 Hotel Brooklyn Bridge Guests)
text: 1 Hotel Central Park continues our love affair with the 1 Hotel properties. This hotel is in a great location within the heart of Manhattan. Close to Central Park, shopping, and Broadway. Upon walking in you will see why this Hotel is a unique get-a-way for an urban  hotel setting. Always great service. Clean and comfortable rooms. Design and function that sets it apart from other similarly priced boutique hotels. You will not be disappointed. Most rooms in NYC are considered small, these are designed to delight and you won't be worrying about size once you experience the comfortable beds and little details the room has to offer. Friendly, courteous staff will take care of you. Highly reccomend this Hotel for a stay in Manhattan and it's sister property 1 Hotel Brooklyn Bridge if heading to Brooklyn.

title: 1 Hotel Central Park
text:
I would say it’s one of the best hotel we have met in New York City, where price equals to quality! 

Excellent service, each part in the room is highly considered and it stays exactly where it’s needed 

Warm thanks to Sunya (Manager) who made this night special for us.

Definitely will come back soon.

title: nice location
text:
綺麗でいいホテルは匂いがして優しくフレンドリーなスタッフが多い。そしてオシャレ。なによりセントラルパークのランニングもしやすかった。1分かからずつくので、おススメです。難を言うなら部屋が少し暗かったことくらい。
ご飯は食べてないからわからないがプラザホテルのフードコートに近く、デリもすぐそばにあるのでそんなに困らない。
アメニティはエコを意識しているホテルなので、必要なものは自分である程度用意した方が良い。

title: Amazing Spot in a Great Location
text:
The room was a bit small, which was to be expected.  Despite the size, it was a beautiful and unique room, with a great window nook overlooking the street and a bit of Central Park.  Even more than the room, the staff were amazing.  The doorman, Chester, was the first to greet us and really set the theme for the rest of our stay.  Friendly, helpful, and always welcomed us back by name and inquired after our day.  One of the concierges, Lorenzo I believe, was also extremely helpful and personable.  One block from Central Park, about two from the main shopping avenues, and a quick walk to Times Square. 
Would recommend this place 100%, and it is definitely worth the price.  We will be returning.

title: Worth 6 stars
text:
This is a really wonderful hotel. It ticks the boxes for a 5 star experience in NYC, enhanced by the signature theme of the 1 Hotel group. To be honest we were apprehensive about this when we booked, but the emphasis on being environmentally friendly did not take away from the luxury aspect of the hotel experience. 

Service was great throughout our 6 nights. We'd arrived at 2am on our first night and the night manager went out of her way to provide us a better room away from the lifts. Amenities were simple but good quality and very well thought out. The Tesla hotel car was really handy for short trips around town. 

Location was great next to central park, with Moma and most of the midtown attractions within walkable distance. Subway is also very close by. 

The only problem we came across was the quality of the sound proofing, when our neighbours slammed their door the walls would literally shake. And being in NYC the overnight ambulances etc would often be noisy even when we are as high as the 12th floor. 

Overall this is probably one of the best hotels we've stayed at in NYC. Pricey but well worth it for the excellent service and location. We would highly recommend it.

title: Mágico
text:
Excelente lugar y comida.
Arquitectura sobresaliente , la ubicación cerca del central park es ideal para salir a correr todas las mañanas.
Está muy bien ubicado si uno desea ver las obras de teatro y hacer compras.

title: Absurdamente incrível
text:
Ótimo talvez não seja digno de um adjetivo p este hotel, todos os detalhes são pensados... além da sustentabilidade... localização perfeita, mimos absurdo, qualidade impecável.... vale conhecer... chegamos a solicitar mais diárias, são tantos detalhes que fica difícil de descrever... de frutas frescas no lobby do hotel, guarda-chuva disponíveis p vc levar p rua... ao tablet na cabeceira da cama ...
Fora que é lindo!!

title: Great hotel and location
text:
Just a block away from Central Park. Good location for shopping. Luxury brands close by. Many restaurants and bars are in the area. You have quality meats right at front. 
The hotel very clean in general. Rooms are small. Beds are comfortable. Loved the window seat in the room. Staff is super friendly and helpful.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text: Great location and view from the 7th floor. Friendly personnel.  Nice quiet connecting rooms for the whole family. Child friendly. Would expect a bigger variety at breakfast. I would definitely come again.

title: Excellent Service, beautifully done!
text: Excellent service. What a great crew! Super down to earth. The rooms are beautifully done with reclaimed materials, the place smells amazing and you won’t find a better place this close to Central Park. Loved staying here and would definitely come back!

title: Me encanto!
text: El hotel es increíble! Con mucha conciencia del medio ambiente y al mismo tiempo muy lujoso. El staff es divino, muy servicial! El lugar muy bien ubicado! No pude ser más feliz de quedarme aquí. Súper recomendado

title: Returning home
text:
We have stayed at 1 Hotel Central Park Hotel 2 years ago and really enjoyed it. 
Our return visit last week was eagerly awaited. Amazingly, as soon as we arrived it felt like coming home.
The hotel is beautifully appointed, great location, amazing restaurant and brilliant staff.
We have stayed in many New York hotels before, including the Waldorf Astoria, but none match the quality of 1 Hotel Central Park Hotel.
Looking forward to returning soon.

title: Great days in NY
text:
Great Days in NY! Excellent Service! We stayed as a family but I would choose this hotel for business purposes also! People are friendly and help you eher the can! Reception desk always at your service with a smile on the lips!
Breakfast but also lunch and dinner at Jams restaurant are highly recommend! The feel the pulse of the town it’s people due to a mix of people hotel guests, business people and girlfriends meeting for chitchat 😄👍😉!
Rooms are fine with enough space and comfort! Super Design! We liked the big window with the relaxing space to observe live on the street in the morning and the night!
Location the best you can have in NY! In the Morning in the Central Park, afternoon Shopping in the 5thAvn and in the evening theatre at Times Square! All in walking distance! Not the cheapest but the best choice for NY! We really liked it!

Klaus

title: Need to be more careful
text:
I like this hotel. I like the idea of reusing materials. I like the idea of environmental friendly. I like the design of the hotel and location. Otherwise, I’m sure I’ll give it one or two stars instead of three now. 

The service could have done better. On my second day, I came back to my room and found the door was opened. It was not wide opened but I could clearly see that it was not closed (opened with a 2 inches gap and could see inside the room). I checked and confirmed my stuff was around.  As the room was tidy up and bedsheet everything was nicely placed, I assumed it was serviced by housecleaning but didn’t close the door completely. I spoke with the concierge about this and told them to be mindful next time. Two days later, I came back and the door was not closed again. This time it was nearly closed but it could still push open without keycard.  It was just careless.

title: セントラルパークから近く快適な滞在
text:
１週間滞在しました。ホテル選びに相当迷いましたが結果とても満足しています。５８丁目の５＆６thAVEにあり、便利です。私たちは毎日セントラルパークを散歩していたので本当に近くて便利でした。

買い物やミュージカル、美術館などどこに行くのも便利でした。最寄りの地下鉄F線の57thは２０１８年１２月までリノベーションのためクローズです。それでも地下鉄をかなり利用しました。

ホテル内はシンプルですが、エコを意識した作りで、緑も多く、不便なこともなく快適でした。Wifi環境も良かったです。コットンのバスローブも私はお気に入りでした。
ロビー階のエレベーター前には木箱にりんごや洋梨があり持ち帰り自由なので、小腹がすくといただいていました。

スタッフは若い人が多く、私服なので最初はスタッフなのか見分けがつかないほどでしたがみなさん笑顔で素敵にサービスをされていました。
予約ではシャワーオンリーの部屋でしたが、チェックイン時にバスタブの部屋に変更してくれましたし、チェックアウトの相談やその他の質問にもすぐ答えていただきました。

マンハッタン内はホテルが高いのでどのくらいのレートでどのくらいの内容を求めるかにもよると思いますが、500ドル前後で快適で便利さを求めるならオススメです（そこそこのホテルでも３００ドルですし高級なら１０００ドル以上だと思いますので）

title: Muy buen hotel a un paso de Central Park
text: Agradable estancia en hotel boutique-ecológico-hiper-reciclado. Personal agradable y hotel muy tranquilo. Room Service y desayunos mejorables en el Jams. La zona para comer o cenar o es carísima o es malísima, no hay termino medio. Excepto un 5 guys y una pizzería en la misma calle.

title: Great Spot
text: Fantastic location, lovely hotel with great bar/restaurant. Staff were excellent. If you want a place near both Central Park and Broadway I highly recommend. The Tesla car is very handy as well. Everyone was very welcoming.

title: 1 Hotel Central Park
text: Excellent service at 1  Hotel Central Park  in New York City. I spent four nights there. It was very pleasant. The staff was very accommodating and took care of all my needs. The room was a little bit pricey but it was very clean and fresh and comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Recommended...great team and superb Concierge desk
text:
The staff at this hotel are exceedingly friendly, professional, together and the welcome is marvellous. For New York City that is a big deal.

Over the years, my family have always stayed at the Plaza or the Ritz Carlton on Central Park. These days we felt like staying somewhere a little more modern and interesting and in an attempt to settle on a new regular hotel we stayed at the Edition back in July and the 1 Hotel this week. Our intention was to choose the one we liked the most for future visits. It is going to be tricky to do that. The staff at both hotels are terrific however the concierge service at The 1 Hotel is exceptional. I thought the service from the concierge at the Edition was very poor by comparison. In fact The 1 hotel concierge service is so good it is up there with the Concierge desks at the Plaza and the Ritz Carlton...superb.

I like the atmosphere and the vibe at the 1 hotel. However the Edition hotel is far more fashionable and has a very cool bar scene while the 1 Hotel is more ‘touristy’

What really swings it towards the 1 Hotel is the location which is excellent. Our corner rooms enjoyed Central Park views. The bedrooms are also best at the 1 hotel. The showers are absolutely excellent although I wasn’t very impressed with their dressing gowns ...while The Edition have the best dressing gowns ever.

I’m often asked by people to recommend a hotel in Manhattan. I think the Plaza is worth staying at once just because it is iconic but the Plaza rooms really are boring. After decades of visiting New York I really did feel it was time for something new and the 1 hotel fits the bill. I noticed a 1 Hotel in Miami on my last visit although I’ve not stayed there. I do however appreciate sustainable, design hotels and The 1 Hotel ticks many boxes. 

Recommended for great service, location, welcome and comfort.

title: Fantastic Stay!
text:
As we had reserved our two Rooms with their Reservation team, we were first bid surprised to see the garanteed upper Floors could not be held...but then, the Reception Manager Steven took care, gave us two great conneted corner Rooms on 9th Floor and a - once in a Lifetime breakfast - we were more than happy. The Rooms were not too big...but of outmost taste and everything works excelently, and the bathrooms are have this great showers...with glaswalls to the room...but (covered by outside courtains...so discrétion is no issue at all) and then there are these window-couches...just a Dream...to sit, lay, chill, read, watch the Streets on to the nearby Central Park...and be happy. By the way, the park is so close, I went jogging three times...another great plus.
All people from the doorman Chester to the Reception, house keeping and concierge Lorenzo reserving us a great table at Ruth Chris' Steak House, were very welcoming and professional. We were also given a late check out on Departure day before leaving to JFK. On this long vacation throughout the EAST-Coast...from Key West...up to NYC, this was maybe our most liked hotel...very modern, perosonal, casual, and NY. Thanks!

title: Fantastico
text:
Adorabile, country chic, bio, in posizione strategica, a 2 passi da Central Park.
Abbiamo trascorso 10 giorni con i figli, nel centro di Manhattan eppure in assoluto relax.
Consigliatissimo, ritorneremo.

title: Very nice hotel near Central Park
text: We loved our rooms at this ghotel. Although it's on the small side, it was lovely with nice touches giving almost an outdoorsy feel. Bathrooms were nicely updated, too, with a sleek modern feel that didn't feel out of place with the overall eco-environmental quality.

title: Best hotel difference
text: 1 Hotel is very different luxury hotel but you have to be able to enjoy the difference. The mixing of nature in the hotel interior and furniture makes you wanting to stay more inside the hotel. I have experienced all of their properties in the US, and have always loved my stay.  Last stay though was disappointing as I was charged extra amount for nothing I’m aware I used and more than a week from my check out date.

title: Almost perfect
text: We really enjoyed our stay. Very well located right next to the fifth and busy neighbor hood but also next to Central Park and the subway to reach further spots. Rooms are a bit small compared to other hotels in NYC. The beds were very comfortable and we loved the bathroom products and teas in the room. The only problems we had were about breakfast. We had two rooms, and every morning something wasn’t right in our order. We received it late, they put regular milk instead of soy milk, they forgot an item... so we would call and it could take up to 45min to get what we initially order. I’ve never seen a service that slow before. Other than that the staff at the hotel was nice, it was really just the room service that wasn’t good.

title: Fantastic
text: The property was pristine, the decor was fantastic, but the people are really what makes this hotel special. Michael B. was so accommodating from the moment I checked in until he helped me load my bags into my car. Michael was courteous, super friendly, and made the stay truly pleasant . As an aside, I saw hotel employees give guests dogs a treat, as well as give a little girl a teddy bear, which just shows the caring nature of the employees. I definitely recommend staying at The 1 and enjoying the homey feel of this place.

title: New York
text: What an experience! The best possible way to stay in a great hotel in New York! Friendly staff, perfect room and superb Restaurant. The location close to Central Park and Fifth Avenue is another plus!

title: The perfect family city escape
text: We love the 1 hotel, it’s location is ideal and it’s calming atmosphere is the perfect balance to spending time in the city. We took our 5 year old daughter for her first trip and the staff treated her like a princess! Also a big plus for us is the food is delicious, healthy and amazing!

title: Just like home ( but better)
text: My kid goes to private school in upper state New York . So we often go to NYC to visit him . We found 1 hotel the first trip , just good luck . We have stayed at least a dozen times there in the past year and a half . The staff is exceptional. There attention to details is fantastic .  The Door men treat you like family. Always greeting you with a smile and your name . Last visit my wife and I pulled into to. 1 Hotel . And in our room was a bottle of Preseco  and some delicious pastries. It was my birthday .  How did they know . Details !  . We will only stay at 1 Hotel in Manhattan .  Customer for life

title: Fabulous Hotel in NYC
text: This is an exceptional hotel.  From the first experience to the last.  Our children love it and would not stay anywhere else and I have to agree.  The atmosphere is calm and relaxed with superior service quietly delivered every time.  Faultless.

title: This place is peace and wellness
text: This was "home" for a month because of unexpected circumstances. Could not have wished for a better place; room, restaurant, lobby. It is like a zen wellness spa. The service was outstanding made extra special by our housekeeper Ms. Phurbu. Love this place!

title: Wonderful Return! Doorman Remembered me and Still Exceptional Peace in Busy NYC
text: It's been about 9 months and the doorman remembered me from last time and that was the start of another great visit!  The upkeep of the rooms continues--fantastic bed, calm feel of the room made for a quiet restful night of sleep. My room right next to the elevator and heard nothing!   I love the cedar and vetiver bath products provided.  The lobby you just want to relax in with the gorgeous plants and eclectic yet peaceful decor.  I will be back!

title: Paying for location when equal options for better pricing available
text: Beautiful hotel with great service. However, the rooms are SMALL and no privacy in the bathroom. There is even a mirror opposite the toilet so that your roommate will easily see you using the RR. For the price, you can get a equal hotel in midtown and pay a taxi $7 to take you to Central Park. The price makes this great property not recommended when so many other options are available.

title: Gorgeous hotel in the best location in the city.  .
text: Beautiful hotel .  Perfect in it's appointments.  Fresh baked items great you and a display of fresh seasonal fruits always on hand.  You will be greeted by helpful and friendly staff ready to take care of anything you need.  Rooms are spotless, luxurious, warm, modern and comfortable.

title: Beautiful Hotel in a Great Location
text:
My wife and I recently spent one night at the 1 Central Park when we were in New York City for dinner and a show. We stayed at the 1 South Beach a couple years ago and really fell in love with the brand concept during that stay, so we were looking forward to having a chance to try this property. Everything about the service, the room, and the location were just perfect for our needs. We really loved the hotel, and so did our dog.

Arrival Experience:

We arrived on a Saturday in the early afternoon, and the hotel impressed us as soon as we drove up. The exterior begins the unique eco-chic theme, with greenery and reclaimed wood right on the side of the building. When we drove up, a staff member was ready to assist with our luggage and take our car for valet parking. Valet parking is pricey (as expected in New York City), at $65 per night with no in/out privileges. However, it’s convenient, so we used it. 

When we entered the lobby, we were immediately impressed by the cool vibe. The variety of materials, décor items, and seating areas is a feast for the senses, with lots of live plants and a great scent. It has a cozy and inviting atmosphere that communicates the environmental focus quite well. The lobby isn’t huge, but it’s a good enough size to have space to relax, and there were usually always staff members around to say hi. The lobby also features a “farmstand” of fruit that is always available. We really loved this feature at the 1 South Beach, because it was basically a buffet of interesting fruits. We were a little disappointed that it basically just featured generic apples and pears at the Central Park location. It’s nice they offer this, but it wasn’t anything interesting.

At check-in, the front desk staff member was extremely nice and personable, and he informed us that our room was ready early. Especially since we had our dog with us, it was great to be able to settle in immediately. Another friendly staff member helped us up to our room on the 15th floor (1514), and he said he would make sure that the hotel’s dog amenities were brought right up, which were delivered less than five minutes later.

Room:

Although it was a pricey upgrade, I booked a Central Park View room, since I wanted to make sure we were able to have the best experience possible. I also elected to add an extra $19 upgrade to ensure that we’d have room on one of the highest floors. Even though the room ended up being quite expensive (close to $700 per night with all the upgrades), it really did not disappoint. We were lucky enough to have a corner room, so we had windows on two sides, which really contributed to making the room feel like it was a good size with lots of natural light. 

The view of Central Park was the highlight of the room, especially with the large built-in window seat positioned perfectly to take it all in. The hotel is one block back from Central Park, and it’s not the tallest building, so none of the rooms have a panoramic view over the park like you might be able to the get when staying somewhere right on the edge of the park, like the Ritz-Carlton. However, the view still is quite great. The Central Park view looks down 6th Avenue to the park and is an interesting and impressive view, looking at both the trees in the park and the buildings surrounding it.

The room itself was not a bad size at all for being in a city, and the décor was great. The use of reclaimed wood and plant materials is carried out so well from the lobby, through the hallways, and right into the rooms. The room had a fun mix of materials, ranging from wood floors, to different reclaimed wood on the ceiling, live plants, and even an iron support beam coming right through the room by the entrance. The fabrics are varied and interesting, and the comfortable and large window seat was an awesome spot to sit. The whole décor of the room was sort of eclectic, but in the most perfectly curated way that is carefully thought out, upscale, and comfortable. It’s not your traditional upscale hotel, but it’s refreshing that it’s different. 

The bathroom is the one portion of the room that could probably be designed better, but I think they were intentionally going for form over function in the design process. As others have mentioned, the bathroom is very open to the rest of the room, and it’s kind of unnecessary for it to be like that. There is a sliding door on the sink/toilet side of the room, but the shower itself is completely glass. There is really only any potential privacy by pulling a sheer curtain across the shower, but that doesn’t really do much. We were fine with the bathroom setup, especially just for one night, but I can see the open concept bathroom wearing thin during a longer stay or if staying with people you’re not that close with.

The bathroom itself was quite nicely appointed and made good use of the small space, with plenty of counter space and a large shower. The marble shower with a rainforest showerhead was really nice and included the 1’s nice smelling natural bath products in full-size bottles. 

We were totally ready for all of the eco-friendly touches from staying at the 1 South Beach in the past. The eco-friendly touches are present without being annoying, and aren’t really even noticeable if you’re not looking for them. The comfortable bed is appointed with an organic mattress and sheets. The rooms don’t offer water bottles, and instead have water glasses with a note reminding you that New York City tap water is filtered and fine to drink. The shower includes a five-minute timer you can use to help conserve water. It’s all little stuff, but creates a unique theme.

Everything about our room was really nice and very comfortable. We were just sad we were only there for one night and couldn't enjoy it for longer.

Pets:

We don't travel with our dog all that frequently, but we were excited to bring her here since the hotel advertises itself as being dog friendly and doesn’t charge a fee for pets. The staff in the lobby always went out of their way to say hi and give our dog attention, and the dog amenities in the room were great. We were surprised when a staff member came to the room with a full BarkBox of treats and toys for her, along with a huge dog bed and water and food bowls. Everything we could need was provided, and we particularly loved getting to take home multiple nice toys and treats that came in the BarkBox. We didn't see any other pets while we were there, but we absolutely recommend bringing pets to this hotel. The location was also so convenient for taking our dog to Central Park for walks and going to the bathroom, since finding green space for a dog can be challenging in some areas of the city.

Other Amenities:

Since we weren’t at the hotel for long, we didn’t get visit many of the hotel facilities, such as the gym. There are also additional common areas on the 2nd floor, which we heard were nice but never saw. We also didn’t have a chance to try the hotel’s restaurant, Jams, which is off of the lobby. It looked very pleasant and nice, in keeping with the hotel’s theme.

Location:

The location of the 1 Central Park is another of its great strengths. You’re only a block from Central Park South, and easily accessible to many popular spots in Midtown. We were easily able to walk to a show in the Theatre District at night, and we were so thankful to leave the craziness of Times Square when returning to the hotel. You’re also just a block away from the Plaza Hotel and the beginning of the posh shopping of Fifth Avenue. Anywhere else in the city is also easily accessible by subway, so it’s an ideal jumping off point. 
	
Overall:

Despite only being there for one night, we had an excellent time at the 1 Central Park and would be happy to return in the future. We had no complaints whatsoever. The eco-chic theme and décor are well done, and the place just has a friendly vibe that is refreshing for a five-star hotel. The staff seems happy to be there and happy to interact with guests. We had a good experience at the 1 South Beach, an even better experience at the 1 Central Park on this trip. We cannot wait to try other 1 Hotels in the future, including the 1 Brooklyn Bridge and the others that are in development.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: It was just what I thought it would be like. So beautiful appointment, loved the bathroom and the water pressure in the shower. So clean and relaxing. The restaurant was so good, and everyone there was absolutely friendly and helpful! Will definitely be back!

title: A 21st Birthday to remember!!
text: I took my daughter to NYC for her 21st birthday. We loved every second spent at this hotel- from the awesome staff (Shane, Christopher, Brett, Chester, and Alex)...the amazing food, our darling room and superb location! The decor is so cool and the atmosphere very relaxing. We could not have chosen a better place to stay and cannot wait to return!Thanks for making this special occasion as great as it could possible be!

title: Love it - Would stay there again and again and again! Great vibe!
text: Every review I've read is right on when it comes to this hotel. I've been to the rooftop bar at 1 Hotel in Miami so I had a feeling the vibe was going to be the same. I repeat all the other reviewers in saying the earthy elegance, environmental vibe and clean, bright ambiance from the lobby to the rooms and restaurant is wonderful. More importantly the staff seem like they really love being there --- and are accommodating in every way!
